<td style=" text-align: center;margin:auto; vertical-align:top"><ix:nonNumeric name="dei:SecurityExchangeName" contextRef="duration_2024-02-07_to_2024-02-07" format="ixt-sec:exchnameen" id="ixv-400">The Nasdaq Stock Market LLC</ix:nonNumeric></td></tr></table> <p style="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405 of this chapter) or Rule <span style="white-space:nowrap">12b-2</span> of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 <span style="white-space:nowrap">(&#167;240.12b-2</span> of this chapter).</p> <p style="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Emerging growth company&#8194;<ix:nonNumeric name="dei:EntityEmergingGrowthCompany" contextRef="duration_2024-02-07_to_2024-02-07" format="ixt-sec:boolballotbox" id="ixv-401">&#9744;</ix:nonNumeric></p> <p style="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a) of the Exchange Act.&#8194;&#9744;</p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&#160;</p> <p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&#160;</p> <p style="line-height:3.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&#160;</p></div></div>

<div style="text-align:center"><div style="width:8.5in;text-align:left;margin-left: auto;margin-right: auto">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;border:0;width:100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td style="width:11%;vertical-align:top" align="left"><span style="font-weight:bold">Item&#8201;1.01.</span></td>
<td align="left" style="vertical-align:top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;text-align:left">Entry into a Material Definitive Agreement. </p></td></tr></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><span style="text-decoration:underline">Transaction Agreements </span></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">As previously disclosed by StepStone Group Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Company</span>&#8221;), certain of the Company&#8217;s consolidated subsidiaries are not wholly-owned by the Company, namely StepStone Group Real Estate LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SRE</span>&#8221;), StepStone Group Real Assets LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SIRA</span>&#8221;) and Swiss Capital Alternative Investments AG, a private company limited by shares incorporated in the canton of Zurich (&#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SPD</span>&#8221; collectively with SRE and SIRA, the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Asset Class Entities</span>&#8221;, and each, an &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Asset Class Entity</span>&#8221;). The Company is announcing today that it has entered into the Transaction Agreements (as defined below), with a path to owning all of the outstanding equity interests of SRE, SIRA and SPD over a defined period of time. The acquisition of equity interests of the Asset Class&#160;Entities is subject to the terms and conditions of the Transaction Agreements. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On February&#160;7, 2024, the Company and StepStone Group LP, a Delaware limited partnership (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Partnership</span>&#8221;) entered into (i)&#160;a Transaction Agreement (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SRE Transaction Agreement</span>&#8221;) with SRE, Jeffrey Giller, solely in his capacity as seller representative (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SRE Asset Class</span><span style="text-decoration:underline"></span><span style="text-decoration:underline">&#160;Head</span>&#8221;), and the seller parties signatory thereto (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SRE Sellers</span>&#8221;), (ii) a Transaction Agreement (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SIRA Transaction Agreement</span>&#8221;) with SIRA, James O&#8217;Leary, solely in his capacity as seller representative (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SIRA Asset Class</span><span style="text-decoration:underline"></span><span style="text-decoration:underline">&#160;Head</span>&#8221;), and the seller parties signatory thereto (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SIRA Sellers</span>&#8221;), and (iii)&#160;a Transaction Agreement (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SPD Transaction Agreement</span>&#8221;, and collectively with the SRE Transaction Agreement and SIRA Transaction Agreement, the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Transaction Agreements</span>&#8221;, and each, a &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Transaction Agreement</span>&#8221;) with StepStone Europe Limited, a private limited liability company incorporated in England and a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, SPD, Marcel Schindler, solely in his capacity as seller representative (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SPD Asset Class</span><span style="text-decoration:underline"></span><span style="text-decoration:underline">&#160;Head</span>&#8221; and collectively with the SRE Asset Class&#160;Head and SIRA Asset Class&#160;Head, the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Asset Class</span><span style="text-decoration:underline"></span><span style="text-decoration:underline">&#160;Heads</span>&#8221;, and each, an &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Asset Class</span><span style="text-decoration:underline"></span><span style="text-decoration:underline">&#160;Head</span>&#8221;), and SC Partner LP, a Cayman Islands exempted limited partnership (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SPD Seller</span>&#8221; and collectively with the SRE Sellers and the SIRA Sellers, the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Sellers</span>&#8221;, and each, a &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Seller</span>&#8221;). </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The Transaction Agreements provide for, among other things and subject to the terms and conditions therein, including with respect to any Acceleration Exchange, Termination Acceleration Exchange and Change of Control Exchange (each as defined in the applicable Transaction Agreement), the exchange of the Sellers&#8217; equity interests in SRE, SIRA and SPD, as applicable, for a combination of (i)&#160;newly created Class&#160;D equity interests in the Partnership with terms substantially similar to the Partnership&#8217;s existing Class&#160;C Units, in the case of SRE and SIRA (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Unit Consideration</span>&#8221;) or shares of the Company&#8217;s Class&#160;A Common Stock, par value $0.001 per share, in the case of SPD (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Class</span><span style="text-decoration:underline"></span><span style="text-decoration:underline">&#160;A Common Stock</span>&#8221;, and such shares, the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">SPD Stock Consideration</span>&#8221;) and (ii)&#160;cash, in up to ten annual exchanges (increased to up to fifteen annual exchanges in certain circumstances in the case of the SIRA Sellers). The portion of the equity interests to be acquired in each annual exchange is set forth in an exchange schedule attached to each Transaction Agreement and is approximately 5% of each Asset Class&#160;Entity on each contemplated annual exchange date. The amount of consideration to be delivered will be calculated using exchange ratios determined each year based on a formula establishing an assumed value of each Asset Class&#160;Entity based on its estimated adjusted net income, relative to an adjusted trading multiple for the Class&#160;A Common Stock relative to the Company&#8217;s estimated adjusted net income. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Pursuant to each Transaction Agreement, and subject to receipt of required regulatory and other approvals, the consideration for the first exchange will be calculated using a reference date of April&#160;1, 2024 (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Initial Reference Date</span>&#8221;) and the first exchange will be consummated promptly following the Initial Reference Date upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in such Transaction Agreement applicable to the first exchange, including publication of the Company&#8217;s audited financial statements for the fiscal year ending March&#160;31, 2024. The Transaction Agreements also provide for up to nine subsequent annual exchanges (or up to fourteen subsequent exchanges in certain circumstances in the case of the SIRA Transaction Agreement), in each case with a calculation reference date of April&#160;1 and consummation promptly following satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in such Transaction Agreement, including delivery of audited financial statements of the Company. The Company also has agreed in the Transaction Agreements to (i)&#160;enter into an exchange agreement pursuant to which the Unit Consideration may be exchanged for shares of Class&#160;A Common Stock (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Exchange Consideration</span>&#8221; and, together with the SPD Stock Consideration, the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Stock Consideration</span>&#8221;) and (ii)&#160;enter into an amendment to its registration rights agreement on or prior to the closing of the first exchange to provide for the registration under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Securities Act</span>&#8221;) of the Stock Consideration. The Transaction Agreements provide that no more than 75&#160;million shares of Class&#160;A Common Stock will be issued as Stock Consideration, subject in certain circumstances to the Company&#8217;s option to increase such limit. </p>
</div></div>



<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<hr style="color:#999999;height:3px;width:100%"/>

<div style="text-align:center"><div style="width:8.5in;text-align:left;margin-left: auto;margin-right: auto">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The Unit Consideration and Stock Consideration will not be registered under the Securities Act or other applicable securities laws, in reliance upon the exemption set forth in Section&#160;4(a)(2) under the Securities Act. The Exchange Consideration will be issued in reliance upon the exemptions set forth in Sections 3(a)(9) and/or 4(a)(2) under the Securities Act. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Each Transaction Agreement contains customary representations, warranties and covenants of the Company, the Partnership and the Sellers. Among other things, (i)&#160;the Company has agreed to convene and hold a meeting of its stockholders for the purpose of obtaining approval of the transactions contemplated by each Transaction Agreement under Nasdaq&#8217;s listing rules, and (ii)&#160;the Sellers have agreed to amend and restate the existing organizational and governance documents of the Asset Class&#160;Entities to reflect certain governance updates and reclassify existing equity interests of the Asset Class&#160;Entities to facilitate the transactions contemplated by each Transaction Agreement. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The consummation of the transactions contemplated by each Transaction Agreement is subject to customary conditions, including (i)&#160;the receipt of required regulatory approval (including the expiration or termination of any applicable waiting period (and any extension thereof) under applicable antitrust laws, including the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act of 1976); (ii) the receipt of the approval of the Company&#8217;s stockholders; (iii)&#160;the absence of any law or injunction preventing the consummation of the transactions contemplated by each Transaction Agreement; (iv)&#160;the completion of certain governance updates or reclassification transactions at the Asset Class&#160;Entity, and (v)&#160;the accuracy of the parties&#8217; representations and warranties (subject to customary materiality qualifiers). </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Each Transaction Agreement may be terminated by the parties to such Transaction Agreement under certain circumstances, including: (i)&#160;by mutual written consent of the Partnership, the Asset Class&#160;Head (or in the case of SPD, the Seller) and the persons owning a majority of the equity interests of the Asset Class&#160;Entity (other than the Company and the Partnership) (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Majority Holders</span>&#8221;), and (ii)&#160;by either the Partnership or the Majority Holders, if any exchange has not occurred on or before the first anniversary of the applicable reference date (other than with respect to certain contemplated skipped exchanges). </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">This description of the Transaction Agreements does not purport to be complete and is subject to, and qualified in its entirety by, the full text of such agreements, copies of which are attached to this Current Report on Form <span style="white-space:nowrap">8-K,</span> respectively as Exhibits 2.1, 2.2 and 2.3 and incorporated by reference into this Item 1.01. The Transaction Agreements have been attached to provide investors with information regarding its terms. It is not intended to provide any other factual or disclosure information about the Company or the other parties to the Transaction Agreements. In particular, the assertions embodied in the representations and warranties contained in the Transaction Agreements are qualified by information in confidential disclosure schedules provided by the parties in connection with the signing of the Transaction Agreements. The confidential disclosure schedules may contain information that modifies, qualifies and creates exceptions to the representations and warranties in the Transaction Agreements and were used for the purpose of allocating risk between the parties rather than establishing matters as facts. The Transaction Agreements contain representations, warranties and covenants by the parties to the Transaction Agreements, and those representations, warranties and covenants may apply standards of materiality in a way that is different from what may be viewed as material to the reader or other investors. Accordingly, investors should not rely on the representations, warranties and covenants in the Transaction Agreements, or any description thereof, as characterizations of the actual state of facts or conditions. Investors should review the Transaction Agreements, or any descriptions thereof, not in isolation, but only in conjunction with the other information about the Company that it includes in reports, statements and other filings it makes with the Securities and Exchange Commission. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Some of the statements in this Current Report on Form <span style="white-space:nowrap">8-K</span> may constitute &#8220;forward-looking statements&#8221; within the meaning of Section&#160;27A of the Securities Act, Section&#160;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. All statements other than statements of historical fact are forward-looking. Words such as &#8220;anticipate,&#8221; &#8220;believe,&#8221; &#8220;continue,&#8221; &#8220;estimate,&#8221; &#8220;expect,&#8221; &#8220;future,&#8221; &#8220;intend,&#8221; &#8220;may,&#8221; &#8220;plan&#8221; and &#8220;will&#8221; and similar expressions identify forward-looking statements. Forward-looking statements, which include, but are not limited to, expectations regarding the proposed transactions in the Transaction Agreements, reflect management&#8217;s current plans, estimates and expectations and are inherently uncertain. The inclusion of any forward-looking information in this Current Report on Form <span style="white-space:nowrap">8-K</span> should not be regarded as a representation that the future plans, estimates or expectations contemplated will be achieved. Forward-looking statements are subject to various risks, uncertainties and assumptions. This information may involve risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from such forward-looking statements. These risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to: failure to obtain the required vote of the Company&#8217;s stockholders in connection with the proposed transactions; the timing to consummate the proposed transactions and the risk that the proposed transactions may not </p>
</div></div>



<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<hr style="color:#999999;height:3px;width:100%"/>

<div style="text-align:center"><div style="width:8.5in;text-align:left;margin-left: auto;margin-right: auto">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
be completed at all or the occurrence of any event, change or other circumstances that could give rise to the termination of the Transaction Agreements; the risk that the conditions to closing of the proposed transactions may not be satisfied or waived; the risk that a governmental or regulatory approval that may be required for the proposed transaction is not obtained or is obtained subject to conditions that are not anticipated; potential litigation relating to, or other unexpected costs resulting from, the proposed transaction; legislative, regulatory and economic developments; the diversion of management&#8217;s time on transaction-related issues; and any other conditions to the Transaction Agreements that are not satisfied or the proposed transactions otherwise do not occur. The Company can give no assurance that the conditions to the proposed transactions will be satisfied, or that it will close within the anticipated time period. Important factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those in forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, global and domestic market and business conditions, successful execution of business and growth strategies and regulatory factors relevant to our business, as well as assumptions relating to our operations, financial results, financial condition, business prospects, growth strategy and liquidity and the risks and uncertainties described in greater detail under the &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; in our annual report on Form <span style="white-space:nowrap">10-K</span> for the fiscal year ended March&#160;31, 2023, and in our subsequent reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, as such factors may be updated from time to time. We undertake no obligation to revise or update any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, except as may be required by law. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">J.P. Morgan Securities LLC acted as financial advisor to the Company. </p> <p style="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&#160;</p>

<td align="left" style="vertical-align:top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;text-align:left">Other Events. </p></td></tr></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Concurrently with the execution of the Transaction Agreements, the Class&#160;B Committee (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Class</span><span style="text-decoration:underline"></span><span style="text-decoration:underline">&#160;B Committee</span>&#8221;) under the Company&#8217;s Stockholders Agreement, dated as of September&#160;20, 2021, entered into a support agreement with the Company (the &#8220;<span style="text-decoration:underline">Support Agreement</span>&#8221;) pursuant to which the Class&#160;B Committee agreed to vote all of the shares of capital stock of the Company that the Class&#160;B Committee has a right to vote in favor of the transactions. The Support Agreement terminates upon the earliest to occur of (i)&#160;the receipt of the stockholders approval required by the Transaction Agreements, (ii)&#160;the closing of any exchange, (iii)&#160;the termination of any Transaction Agreement, and (iv)&#160;the mutual written consent of the parties. The foregoing description of the Support Agreement does not purport to be complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the Support Agreement, which is filed as Exhibit 99.1 to this Current Report on Form <span style="white-space:nowrap">8-K</span> and is incorporated herein by reference. </p> <p style="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&#160;</p>

 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE" STYLE="line-height:Normal">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 2.1 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B><I>STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B><I>Execution Version </I></B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.50pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>TRANSACTION AGREEMENT </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>by and among </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>STEPSTONE
GROUP INC., </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>STEPSTONE GROUP LP, </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>STEPSTONE GROUP REAL ESTATE LP, </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>JEFFREY GILLER, as the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>AND </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>THE SELLERS NAMED
HEREIN </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Dated as of February&nbsp;7, 2024 </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">4.4</P></TD>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annexes</U>: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annex A</U>
&#150; Calculation of Exchange Value </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annex B</U> &#150; Required Regulatory Approvals </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annex C</U> &#150; Termination Acceleration Exchange </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annex
D</U> &#150; Power of Attorney </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">-ii- </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedules: </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule A</U> &#150; Seller Exchange Schedule </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule
B</U> &#150; Annual Exchange Schedule </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule C</U> &#150; Schedule of Sellers </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibits</U>: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibit A</U> &#150; Form of Exchange
Agreement </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibit B</U> &#150; Form of Registration Rights Agreement </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">-iii- </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>TRANSACTION AGREEMENT </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">This TRANSACTION AGREEMENT (this &#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;), dated as of February&nbsp;7, 2024, is by and among StepStone Group Inc., a
Delaware corporation (&#147;<U>STEP</U>&#148;), StepStone Group LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#147;<U>SSG</U>&#148;, and together with STEP, &#147;<U>StepStone</U>&#148;), StepStone Group Real Estate LP, a Delaware limited partnership
(&#147;<U>SRE</U>&#148;), Jeffrey Giller, solely in his capacity as the representative of the Sellers under this Agreement (the &#147;<U>Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;), and each equityholder of SRE identified as a Seller on
<U>Schedule C</U> attached hereto (each, a &#147;<U>Seller</U>&#148;, and collectively, the &#147;<U>Sellers</U>&#148;, and together with STEP, SSG, SRE, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, each a &#147;<U>Party</U>&#148; and collectively, the
&#147;<U>Parties</U>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>RECITALS </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>to support the ongoing operational integration of business practices and to enhance client and staff experiences at
StepStone and SRE, the Parties desire to enter into this Transaction Agreement to facilitate the medium to long-term economic integration of the Parties; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>in furtherance of the purposes in the foregoing recital, the Parties intend for the Sellers to exchange, in a series of
transactions, the Sellers&#146; equity interests in SRE for equity interests in SSG (or cash in lieu of a portion thereof) (collectively, the &#147;<U>Transactions</U>&#148;, and each such exchange, an &#147;<U>Exchange</U>&#148;); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, substantially concurrently with the execution and delivery of this Agreement, StepStone has separately entered into (i)&nbsp;a
transaction agreement (the &#147;<U>SIRA Transaction Agreement</U>&#148;) with StepStone Group Real Assets LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#147;<U>SIRA</U>&#148;), certain equityholders of SIRA parties thereto (the &#147;<U>SIRA
Sellers</U>&#148;) and the seller representative of SIRA (the &#147;<U>SIRA Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;a transaction agreement (the &#147;<U>SPD Transaction Agreement</U>&#148;) with Swiss Capital Alternative
Investments AG, a private company limited by shares incorporated in the canton of Zurich (&#147;<U>SPD</U>&#148;), SC Partner LP, a Cayman Islands exempted limited partnership (the &#147;<U>SPD Seller</U>&#148;), the seller representative of SPD
(the &#147;<U>SPD Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;) and StepStone Europe Limited, a private limited liability company incorporated in England; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, subject to the terms and conditions in this Agreement, including with respect to any Acceleration Exchange, Termination
Acceleration Exchange and Change of Control Exchange (each as defined below), the Parties intend to consummate ten (10)&nbsp;annual Exchanges, with the first Exchange to be conducted with a reference date of April&nbsp;1, 2024 (the &#147;<U>Initial
Reference Date</U>&#148;) and to be consummated promptly following the Initial Reference Date upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in this Agreement applicable to such Exchange, and the nine (9)&nbsp;subsequent Exchanges to be
conducted with a reference date of each of the nine (9)&nbsp;following anniversaries of the Initial Reference Date (such dates, together with the Initial Reference Date, each, a &#147;<U>Reference Date</U>&#148;) and to be consummated promptly
following each applicable Reference Date upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in this Agreement applicable to such Exchanges; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>the Parties intend that, at the consummation of the tenth (10<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">th</SUP>)
Exchange or the Acceleration Exchange (as defined below), SSG will own one hundred percent (100%) of all the outstanding equity interests of SRE currently not owned by SSG; and </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, as a condition and inducement to STEP and SSG to enter into this Agreement
and as a condition to each Closing, each Seller desires to, by executing this Agreement, enter into a Power of Attorney (as defined below) in the form attached hereto as <U>Annex D</U>, appointing the Asset Class&nbsp;Head and any other Person or
Persons referred to therein, and each of them, as such Seller&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">attorneys-in-fact</FONT></FONT> with authority to act on behalf of such Seller in connection with the
Transactions, and each Seller, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, and SRE agree to use best efforts to deliver SSG and STEP a duly executed, witnessed, accepted by the principal and notarized (in each case, to the extent required by applicable Laws) Power
of Attorney as promptly as possible (and in any event within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days of this Agreement). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B>, in
consideration of the foregoing and the mutual representations, warranties, covenants and agreements set forth herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, and intending to be legally
bound hereby, the parties hereby agree as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE I </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>THE EXCHANGE </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.1 <U>The
Exchange</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Upon the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement, at each Closing (as defined below), each Participating
Seller (as defined below) shall sell, convey, assign, transfer and deliver to SSG, and SSG shall purchase, acquire and accept from each Seller, all of such Seller&#146;s right, title and interest in and to such amount of Equity Securities of SRE in
accordance with the principles set forth on <U>Schedule A</U> attached hereto (the &#147;<U>Seller Exchange Schedule</U>&#148;); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head may modify the Seller Exchange Schedule no later than ten
(10)&nbsp;days prior to the Reference Date of such Exchange with the prior written approval by the GP Board (unless such modifications are consistent with the methodology stated in the Seller Exchange Schedule and reflect only changes in ownership
due to transfers among the Sellers or other active employees of SRE, in which case the written approval of the GP Board is not required); <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, <U>that</U>, in the event the Seller Exchange Schedule is substantially
modified by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, the Asset Class&nbsp;head shall, in good faith, notify and consult with the Sellers regarding the changes in circumstances relating to any such modification; <U>provided</U>, <U>further</U>, <U>that</U>, any
such modification shall not change the aggregate amount of Equity Securities of SRE being exchanged in such Exchange, which shall, in the aggregate, equal the amount of Equity Securities of SRE set forth on <U>Schedule B</U> attached hereto (the
&#147;<U>Annual Exchange Schedule</U>&#148;) opposite the Reference Date of such Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, (i)&nbsp;any Equity Securities of SRE exchanged pursuant to this Agreement may be referred to as the &#147;<U>Exchanged
Units</U>&#148;; (ii) any Seller who participates in an Exchange may be referred to as a &#147;<U>Participating Seller</U>&#148; for purposes of such Exchange; and (iii)&nbsp;a &#147;<U>Participation Percentage</U>&#148; with respect a Participating
Seller in an Exchange shall mean a percentage representing (x)&nbsp;the Exchanged Units delivered by such Participating Seller in such Exchange <I>divided </I><I>by</I><I> </I>(y)&nbsp;the aggregate Exchanged Units delivered by all Participating
Sellers in such Exchange. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 2 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) In exchange therefor, at each Closing (except with respect to an Acceleration Exchange,
which shall be governed by <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6</U>), SSG shall convey to each Participating Seller such Participating Seller&#146;s Individual Exchange Value by (i)&nbsp;delivering to such Participating Seller an amount in cash equal
to (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Baseline Value <I>multiplied by</I> the Cash Election Percentage with respect to such Participating Seller for such Exchange as determined pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>, <I>plus</I> (y)&nbsp;the Fractional
Unit Payment, and (ii)&nbsp;issuing to such Participating Seller the number of whole SSG Class&nbsp;D Units (rounded down to the nearest whole SSG Class&nbsp;D Unit) equal to (x)&nbsp;(A) the Individual Exchange Value <I>less</I> (B)&nbsp;the cash
amount delivered pursuant to the foregoing clause (i)(x), <I>divided by</I> (y)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP. Any SSG Class&nbsp;D Units issued by SSG to the Sellers pursuant to his Agreement may be referred to
herein as the &#147;<U>Consideration Units</U>&#148;. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) At each Closing, each Participating Seller shall also convey, assign, transfer
and deliver to SSG all of such Participating Seller&#146;s right, title and interest in and to a number of membership interests of SRE GP, for no additional consideration, equal to (i)&nbsp;such Participating Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage
in such Exchange <I>multiplied by </I>(ii)&nbsp;the number of total issued and outstanding membership interests of SRE GP <I>multiplied by </I>(iii)&nbsp;the Equity Percentage with respect to such Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) In lieu of the issuance of any fractional SSG Class&nbsp;D Unit, any Seller who would otherwise have been entitled to a fraction of a SSG
Class&nbsp;D Unit pursuant to the terms of this Agreement shall be paid cash, without interest (the &#147;<U>Fractional Unit Payment</U>&#148;), in an amount equal to (i)&nbsp;the fractional SSG Class&nbsp;D Unit to which such Seller would otherwise
be entitled under <U>Article I</U> of this Agreement <I>multiplied by</I> (ii)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP, and rounded to the nearest cent. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.2 <U>Closing</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) The
closing of any Exchange (each a &#147;<U>Closing</U>&#148;) shall take place remotely via electronic exchange of documents and signatures, as promptly as practicable following, but in no event later than, the third (3<SUP
STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">rd</SUP>) Business Day after the satisfaction or waiver of each of the conditions set forth in <U>Article II</U> of this Agreement applicable to such Closing (other than, but subject to satisfaction of, the
conditions to be satisfied on the applicable Closing Date); <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, in no event shall a Closing take place prior to the first (1<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">st</SUP>) Business Day after the latest of
(i)&nbsp;the last day of the determination period for the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP for such Exchange, (ii)&nbsp;the date on which STEP issues its audited financial statements for its latest fiscal year ending prior to
the Closing (the &#147;<U>STEP Audited Financials</U>&#148;), and (iii)&nbsp;the date on which the Adjustment Statement is delivered in respect of the preceding Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, the date of the Closing with respect to an
Exchange may be referred to as the &#147;<U>Closing Date</U>&#148; of such Exchange, and the effective time of the Closing with respect to an Exchange may be referred as the &#147;<U>Effective Time</U>&#148; of such Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) The failure to consummate an Exchange on the date and time determined pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.2(a)</U> shall not
result in the termination of this Agreement or relieve any Party of any of its obligations under this Agreement. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 3 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.3 <U>Cash Election</U>. For each Exchange other than the first Exchange, the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head may deliver to SSG a notice (a &#147;<U>Cash Election Notice</U>&#148;) setting forth a percentage of the Reduced Baseline Value of such Exchange to be settled in cash for each Participating Seller (such percentage, the &#147;<U>Cash
Election Percentage</U>&#148;); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, for the first Exchange, the Cash Election Percentage for each Participating Seller shall be ten percent (10%) (except as otherwise designated by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head and notified to
SSG within ten (10)&nbsp;days of this Agreement); <U>provided</U>, <U>further</U>, in no event shall the aggregate cash settlement amount to be paid in the first Exchange exceed ten percent (10%) of the Baseline Exchange Value of the first Exchange,
and in no event shall the aggregate cash settlement amount to be paid in any subsequent Exchange exceed twenty percent (20%) of the Reduced Baseline Value of such Exchange; <U>provided</U>, <U>further</U>, that upon the request of the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head, SSG shall consider in good faith increasing such permitted cash settlement amount if the Sellers would experience materially greater aggregate tax liability in one or more Exchanges than previously anticipated. Each Cash Election
Notice shall be delivered by May&nbsp;1 of the year prior to the Reference Date of such Exchange. In the event that no Cash Election Notice is properly and timely delivered for an Exchange, the Cash Election Percentage for each Participating Seller
shall be deemed to be zero with respect to such Exchange. Upon receipt of a Cash Election Notice properly and timely delivered, subject to the restrictions under applicable Law, any governance documents of STEP and SSG, and any credit agreement,
loan agreement, note, indenture or other financing agreements under which STEP or SSG is bound, and subject to the receipt of any applicable stockholder or regulatory approval, SSG, at its sole discretion, shall use commercially reasonable efforts
to deliver, or cause to be delivered, the cash portion of the Baseline Exchange Value (or, for each Exchange other than the first Exchange, the Reduced Baseline Value); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, to the extent SSG does not deliver, or cause to be
delivered, all or a portion of such cash consideration, the cash portion shall be reduced and, consequently, the number of Consideration Units deliverable shall be increased. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.4 <U>Distribution Adjustments</U>. It is intended that any distributions made by SRE in respect of the Exchanged Units with respect to any
period ending prior to the Reference Date for an Exchange will inure to the benefit of the Participating Sellers; and that the Consideration Units issued in such Exchange shall entitle the Participating Sellers to receive any distributions made by
SSG with respect to any period commencing on or after the applicable Reference Date. In the event any such distributions are paid or made to a Person in a manner inconsistent with such intent, then the Parties shall make appropriate adjustments
(i)&nbsp;to the consideration delivered in such Exchange or in the subsequent Exchanges or (ii)&nbsp;to distributions or other payments made by SSG with respect to the Consideration Units after the applicable Reference Date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.5 <U><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">True-Up</FONT></U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Adjustment Statement</U>. As soon as practicable, but in no event later than ten (10)&nbsp;days after each issuance of the STEP Audited
Financials, SSG shall deliver to the Asset Class&nbsp;Head a statement (an &#147;<U>Adjustment Statement</U>&#148;) setting forth SSG&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-calculation</FONT> of the Exchange Value of the last Exchange by
applying the Applicable SRE Multiple as of the preceding Reference Date to the actual Adjusted Net Income of SRE (rather than SRE Budget ANI) used to prepare the STEP Audited Financials (such recalculated amount, the &#147;<U>Final Exchange
Value</U>&#148;). An &#147;<U>Upward Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between (w)&nbsp;the Final Exchange Value and (x)&nbsp;the Exchange Value originally calculated and used for such Exchange
(the &#147;<U>Original Exchange Value</U>&#148;); and a &#147;<U>Downward Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between (y)&nbsp;the Original Exchange Value and (z)&nbsp;the Final Exchange Value.
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 4 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Upward Adjustment</U>. If an Upward Adjustment Amount exists, then in the current
year Exchange, (i)&nbsp;for any Person who is a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, the Individual Exchange Value to be delivered to such Person shall equal (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Baseline Value to be delivered to such Person in such
Exchange <I>plus</I> (y)&nbsp;the product of (A)&nbsp;the Upward Adjustment Amount<I> multiplied by</I> (B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Exchange for which the Adjustment Statement is provided (the &#147;<U>Original
Exchange</U>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;for any Person who was a Participating Seller in the Original Exchange but is not a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, then at the Closing of the current year Exchange (or if the Original Exchange
is the final Exchange for such Person, then as soon as practicable following the date on which STEP issues the STEP Audited Financials for the current year Exchange), SSG shall (x)&nbsp;issue such Person an additional amount of Consideration Units
(rounded down to the nearest whole Consideration Unit) equal to (A)&nbsp;the Upward Adjustment Amount<I> multiplied by</I> (B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, <I>divided by</I> (C)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP, and (y)&nbsp;pay such Person an amount of cash equal to the Fractional Unit Payment. For the avoidance of doubt, any reference to Upward Adjustment Amount in this paragraph shall be a reference to the
Upward Adjustment Amount with respect to the Original Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Downward Adjustment</U>. If a Downward Adjustment Amount exists,
then in the current year Exchange, (i)&nbsp;for any Person who is a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Baseline Value to be delivered to such Person shall be reduced by an amount equal to the product of
(A)&nbsp;the Downward Adjustment Amount <I>multiplied by</I> (B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, and (y)&nbsp;the Individual Exchange Value to be delivered to such Person shall equal the Reduced Baseline
Value as adjusted by the foregoing <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)(</U><U>i</U><U>)(x)</U>, (ii) for any Person who was a Participating Seller in the Original Exchange but is not a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, then, at
SSG&#146;s option, (x)&nbsp;such Person shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount of cash equal to (A)&nbsp;the Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by </I>(B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation
Percentage in the Original Exchange, or (y)&nbsp;an amount equal to (A)&nbsp;the Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by </I>(B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, shall be carried forward to the next
succeeding future Exchange(s) participated by such Person. To the extent the Individual Exchange Value would fall below zero as a result of an adjustment pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>, then, at SSG&#146;s option,
(1)&nbsp;any Person who was a Participating Seller in the Original Exchange shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount in cash equal to (x)&nbsp;the remaining Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by
</I>(y)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, or (2)&nbsp;an amount equal to (x)&nbsp;the remaining Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by </I>(y)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the
Original Exchange, shall be carried forward to the next succeeding future Exchange(s) participated by such Person. To the extent any remaining balance of the applicable portion of any Downward Adjustment Amount exists immediately after the Closing
of the final Exchange with respect to a Seller, such Seller shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount in cash equal to such remaining balance. Each Seller acknowledges and agrees that, in the event that a
Seller does not timely pay SSG any cash amount payable by such Seller to SSG pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>, SSG shall have the right to set off such cash amount against any dividends, distributions or other income
allocations from SSG or its Affiliates to such Seller or its Affiliates and against any other amounts (including, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 5 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
employment compensation and expense reimbursements) otherwise payable by SSG or its Affiliates to such Seller or its Affiliates. For the avoidance of doubt, any reference to Downward Adjustment
Amount in this paragraph shall be a reference to the Downward Adjustment Amount with respect to the Original Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.6
<U>Acceleration Exchange</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Acceleration Exchange</U>. At any point following the Exchange with respect to the April&nbsp;1,
2028 Reference Date, the Majority Holders and SSG may, by mutual agreement, elect to accelerate the remaining annual Exchanges in one final Exchange as of the Reference Date immediately following such election. Each Seller agrees that in the event
the Majority Holders and SSG so elect to accelerate the remaining annual Exchanges, the Majority Holders and SSG may, in their sole discretion, require each Seller to sell and surrender all Equity Securities of SRE held by such Seller in such final
Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, such final Exchange may be referred to as the &#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange</U>&#148;. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b)
<U>Holdback</U>. At the Closing of the Acceleration Exchange, Consideration Units representing fifty percent (50%) of the Reduced Baseline Value (the &#147;<U>Holdback</U>&#148;) shall not be issued by SSG but shall instead be held back to
facilitate a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">true-up</FONT> following the issuance of the STEP Audited Financials for the Final Projection Year (it being understood that, without limiting the provisions set forth in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>, the Cash Election Percentage for such Acceleration Exchange shall not exceed fifty percent (50%) for any Seller). For the avoidance of doubt, the Holdback shall not include any cash consideration included in
the Reduced Baseline Value. SSG shall pay to the Participating Sellers (in proportion to their respective Participation Percentages for such Acceleration Exchange) an amount equal to all dividends, distributions (including tax distributions) and
other income with respect to fifty percent (50%) of the unissued Consideration Units included in the Holdback, which payment shall be made at the same time as such dividends, distributions and other income are distributed or paid to the other
partners of SSG generally in accordance with the terms of the SSG LPA; SSG shall pay to the Participating Sellers (in proportion to their respective Participation Percentages for such Acceleration Exchange) an amount equal to all dividends,
distributions and other income with respect to the other fifty percent (50%) of the unissued Consideration Units included in the Holdback, which payment shall be made at such time as, and to the extent, the Participating Sellers become entitled to
such Consideration Units. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement</U>. As soon as practicable, but in no event later than ten
(10)&nbsp;days after the issuance of the STEP Audited Financials for the Final Projection Year, SSG shall deliver to the Asset Class&nbsp;Head a statement (the &#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement</U>&#148;) setting forth SSG&#146;s <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-calculation</FONT> of the Exchange Value of the Acceleration Exchange by applying the Applicable SRE Multiple as of the Reference Date of the Acceleration Exchange to the Actual Acceleration SRE ANI (rather than
Acceleration SRE Budget ANI) (such recalculated amount, the &#147;<U>Final Acceleration Exchange Value</U>&#148;). An &#147;<U>Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference
between the Final Acceleration Exchange Value and the Exchange Value originally calculated and used for the Acceleration Exchange (the &#147;<U>Original Acceleration Exchange Value</U>&#148;); and a &#147;<U>Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment
Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between the Original Acceleration Exchange Value and the Final Acceleration Exchange Value. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 6 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) <U>No Adjustment</U>. If the Final Acceleration Exchange Value equals the Original
Acceleration Exchange Value, SSG shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of the date of determination of the Final Acceleration Exchange Value) release the Holdback to each Participating Seller in proportion to such
Participating Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) <U>Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment</U>. Upon the delivery of the
Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement, if an Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount exists, SSG shall promptly deliver to each Participating Seller in such Acceleration Exchange (i)&nbsp;such Participating Seller&#146;s Participation
Percentage of amounts in the Holdback, (ii)&nbsp;cash equal to the Fractional Unit Payment, and (iii)&nbsp;a number of issued Consideration Units (rounded down to the nearest whole Consideration Unit) equal to (x)&nbsp;such Participating
Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage of the Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount (net of any Downward Adjustment carried forward pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>) <I>divided by</I> (y)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(f) <U>Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment</U>. Upon the delivery of the
Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement, if a Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount exists, SSG shall (i)&nbsp;retain for SSG&#146;s account from the Holdback an amount equal to the Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount
(together with all dividends, distributions and other income with respect to the relevant unissued Consideration Units) (the remaining Holdback after such deduction, the &#147;<U>Adjusted Holdback</U>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;following the completion
of step (i), promptly release the Adjusted Holdback, if any, to each Participating Seller in proportion to such Participating Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage for such Acceleration Exchange, in each case net of any Downward Adjustment for such
Participating Seller carried forward pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(g) <U>Further Adjustment</U>. In the event
the Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount exceeds the Exchange Value of the Holdback, each Seller shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount in cash equal to (i)&nbsp;such Participating Seller&#146;s
Participation Percentage of (ii)&nbsp;(x) the Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount <I>less</I> (y)&nbsp;the Exchange Value of the Holdback. Each Seller acknowledges and agrees that, in the event that a Seller does not timely pay SSG any
cash amount payable by such Seller to SSG pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(g)</U>, SSG shall have the right to set off such cash amount against any dividends, distributions or other income allocations from SSG or its Affiliates to
such Seller or its Affiliates and against any other amounts (including, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, employment compensation and expense reimbursements) otherwise payable by SSG or its Affiliates to such Seller or its Affiliates. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 7 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(h) <U>Termination Acceleration Exchange</U>. With respect to any Seller who is terminated
(with or without cause), resigns or retires (an &#147;<U>Acceleration Party</U>&#148;), such Seller&#146;s remaining Equity Securities in SRE shall be treated as set forth in <U>Annex C</U> attached hereto. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) <U>Change of Control Exchange</U>. If a Change of Control of STEP or SSG shall occur, then the Exchanges provided for herein shall
continue as scheduled; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) the STEP Multiple for all Exchanges occurring on or after the date of the
Change of Control shall be the lower of (x) 40 and (y)&nbsp;the STEP Multiple implied by the fair value (as determined in good faith by the Board of Directors of STEP (the &#147;<U>STEP Board</U>&#148;)) of the consideration paid in such Change of
Control for each share of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or unit of SSG, as applicable; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(</U><U>i</U><U>)(</U><U>i</U><U>)</U> shall be subject to
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.8</U>, and the provisions relating to Skipped Exchanges shall apply, if the applicable STEP Multiple as determined in accordance with the foregoing is below 16; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) for the purposes of subsequent calculations of the Exchange Value, the Exchange Value shall be calculated based on the fair value (as
determined in good faith by the STEP Board) of the consideration paid in such Change of Control for each share of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or unit of SSG, as applicable; and </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iii) the Exchange Value to be delivered to each Participating Seller for Exchanges occurring on or after the effective date of the Change of
Control shall be payable in the kind of securities, cash or other property paid in such Change of Control to other equityholders of STEP or SSG (such securities, cash or other property, the &#147;<U>Reference Property</U>&#148; and the amount and
kind of Reference Property that a holder of one Consideration Unit would be entitled to receive, a &#147;<U>Reference Property Unit</U>&#148;); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, (x)&nbsp;if the Reference Property consists of more than a single type of
consideration to be determined based in part upon any form of equityholder election, then the composition of the Reference Property Unit shall be deemed to be the weighted average of the types and amounts actually received by the other equityholders
of STEP or SSG in the Change of Control transaction, and (y)&nbsp;if the Reference Property consists of equity securities that are not Publicly Traded Securities, STEP and SSG shall use commercially reasonable efforts, acting in good faith, to
structure the Change of Control transaction to avoid a disproportionate and materially adverse effect on the Sellers relative to the other equityholders of STEP or SSG party to such Change of Control transaction. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.7 <U>Adjustment for Reclassification</U>. If the number of outstanding Equity Securities of STEP, SSG or SRE have been changed into a
different number of units or a different class (including by reason of any reclassification, unit split (including a reverse unit split), recapitalization, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">split-up,</FONT> combination, exchange of units,
readjustment or other similar transaction), or if a unit dividend or unit distribution thereon is declared, the relevant provisions of this Agreement shall be equitably adjusted to reflect such change so as to provide SSG and Sellers the same
economic effect as contemplated by this Agreement prior to such event; <U>provided</U>, that nothing in this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.7</U> shall be deemed to permit or authorize SRE to effect any such change that it is not authorized or
permitted to undertake. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.8 <U>Limitations on Exchanges</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Notwithstanding the other provisions of this <U>Article I</U>, none of the Sellers shall be obligated to effect any Exchange if the STEP
Multiple with respect to such Exchange is below 16 (such Exchange, a &#147;<U>Skipped Exchange</U>&#148;). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 8 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) Notwithstanding the provisions of this <U>Article I</U>, neither STEP nor SSG shall be
obligated to effect any Exchange if, after giving effect to such Exchange, STEP and/or SSG would have issued, pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and/or the Other Transaction Agreements, more than an aggregate of 75&nbsp;million Consideration
Units and/or Consideration Securities (as such term is defined in each Other Transaction Agreement) (the &#147;<U>Aggregate Equity Limit</U>&#148;). To the extent an Exchange would otherwise result in the issuance of Consideration Units in excess of
the Aggregate Equity Limit, STEP or SSG may, at its option and in its sole discretion, (i)&nbsp;increase the Cash Election Percentage for such Exchange (notwithstanding the cap set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>) so as to complete
such Exchange without exceeding the Aggregate Equity Limit, or (ii)&nbsp;increase the Aggregate Equity Limit; provided, that, upon the request of the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, STEP and/or SSG shall consider in good faith using its commercially
reasonable efforts to effectuate the foregoing clause (ii) (and failing that, the foregoing clause (i)). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) For the avoidance of doubt,
no Closing shall occur with respect to a Skipped Exchange and Sellers shall not be required to sell, convey or deliver Equity Securities of SRE in connection with such Skipped Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) In the event of a Skipped Exchange, the Exchanged Units that would otherwise have been subject to such Exchange (i)&nbsp;shall be subject
to the next annual Exchange for which the STEP Multiple is equal to or greater than 16 or the Aggregate Equity Limit has not been exceeded, as applicable, (ii)&nbsp;the Exchange Value for such Exchanged Units shall be calculated using the actual
Adjusted Net Income of SRE (rather than SRE Budget ANI) for the fiscal year that was the subject of the Skipped Exchange and (iii)&nbsp;no <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">true-up</FONT> pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5</U> shall be
made with respect to such Exchanged Units. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE II </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>CONDITIONS TO EACH CLOSING </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.1 <U>Conditions to All Parties</U><U>&#146;</U><U> Obligations to Close</U>. The obligations of SSG and STEP, on the one hand, and of the
Sellers, on the other hand, to complete any Closing contemplated by this Agreement are subject to the fulfillment at or prior to such Closing of each of the following conditions (any or all of which may be waived in whole or in part with respect to
the Sellers by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head): </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Required Regulatory Approvals</U>. The authorizations, consents, orders or approvals
of, or declarations or filings with, and the expirations or terminations of waiting periods required from, any Governmental Authorities set forth in <U>Annex B</U> attached hereto, with respect to this Agreement, the Transactions, and the relevant
Exchange (all such permits, approvals, filings and consents and the expiration or termination of all such waiting periods being referred to as the &#147;<U>Required Regulatory Approvals</U>&#148;), and all such Required Regulatory Approvals shall be
in full force and effect. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Stockholders Approval</U>. The STEP Stockholder Approval shall have been obtained and shall be in full
force and effect. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Nasdaq Approval</U>. The Nasdaq Approval shall have been obtained and shall be in full force and effect. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) <U>No Injunctions or Restraints</U>. No applicable Law or injunction enacted, entered, promulgated, enforced or issued by any Governmental
Authority or other legal restraint or prohibition preventing the consummation of the Transactions or the relevant Closing shall be in effect. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 9 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) <U>Completion of the Reclassification Transaction</U>. The Reclassification Transaction
shall have been completed. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.2 <U>Conditions to the Sellers</U><U>&#146;</U><U> Obligations</U>. The obligations of the Sellers to
complete each Closing contemplated by this Agreement are subject to the fulfillment at or prior to such Closing of each of the following conditions (any or all of which may be waived in whole or in part by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head): </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Representations and Warranties</U>. The representations and warranties regarding SSG and STEP in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;4.4</U>
shall be true and correct in all material respects on and as of the date hereof and on and as of each applicable Effective Time as though such representations and warranties were made on and as of such Effective Time, or in the case of
representations and warranties that are made as of a specified date, such representations and warranties shall be true and correct as of such specified date, and the other representations and warranties regarding SSG and STEP in Article <U>IV</U> of
this Agreement shall be true and correct in all respects on and as of the date hereof and on and as of each applicable Effective Time as though such representations and warranties were made on and as of such Effective Time, or in the case of
representations and warranties that are made as of a specified date, such representations and warranties shall be true and correct as of such specified date, except, in each case, where the failure of such representations and warranties to be true
and correct has not, or would not, individually or in the aggregate, reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on SSG&#146;s and STEP&#146;s ability to consummate the Transactions. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Deliverables</U>. The following documents shall have been delivered to each Seller: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) the Exchange Agreement duly executed by SSG and STEP; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, no such agreement needs to be delivered if SSG and
STEP have already delivered such agreement at a prior Closing and such agreement remains in full force and effect; and </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) the
Registration Rights Agreement duly executed by STEP and the parties necessary for such agreement (as contemplated to be amended pursuant to this Agreement) to be effective (except for the Sellers); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, no such agreement
needs to be delivered if STEP has already delivered such agreement at a prior Closing and such agreement remains in full force and effect. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) SSG and STEP shall have delivered a certificate to each Seller to the effect set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.2(a)</U>, signed
by a duly authorized officer of each of SSG and STEP. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 10 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.3 <U>Conditions to SSG</U><U>&#146;</U><U>s and STEP</U><U>&#146;</U><U>s Obligations</U>.
The obligations of SSG and STEP to complete each Closing contemplated by this Agreement are subject to the fulfillment at or prior to such Closing of each of the following conditions (any or all of which may be waived in whole or in part by SSG and
STEP): </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Representations and Warranties</U>. The representations and warranties regarding each Seller in <U>Article III</U> of this
Agreement shall be true and correct in all respects on and as of the date hereof and on and as of each applicable Effective Time as though such representations and warranties were made on and as of such Effective Time, or in the case of
representations and warranties that are made as of a specified date, such representations and warranties shall be true and correct as of such specified date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Deliverables</U>. Each Seller shall have delivered to SSG and STEP each of the following documents: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) an Assignment of Interest (the &#147;<U>Assignment of Interest</U>&#148;) in a form to be agreed between SSG and the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head, setting forth the amount of Exchanged Units to be exchanged pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, duly executed by or on behalf of such Seller; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) a spousal consent (to the extent applicable) in a form to be agreed between SSG and the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, duly executed by such
Seller&#146;s spouse; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, no such spousal consent needs to be delivered if such Seller&#146;s spouse has already delivered such spousal consent at a prior Closing and such spousal consent remains in full force and effect;
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iii) a properly executed applicable IRS Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">W-8</FONT> or
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">W-9,</FONT> as applicable, from such Seller; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iv) a properly executed certificate under Treasury
Regulation <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">1.1446(f)-2(b)</FONT> or <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">1.1445(f)-2(c)</FONT> from such Seller, if applicable; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(v) the amended and restated SSG LPA duly executed by or on behalf of such Seller; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, no such documentation needs
to be delivered if such Seller has already delivered such documentation at a prior Closing and such documentation remains in full force and effect; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(vi) the amended and restated SRE Limited Partnership Agreement and the amended and restated SRE GP Limited Liability Company Agreement, in
each case duly executed by or on behalf of such Seller; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, no such documentation needs to be delivered if such Seller has already delivered such documentation at a prior Closing and such documentation remains in full force
and effect; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(vii) an Exchange Agreement duly executed by or on behalf of such Seller; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, no such agreement
needs to be delivered if such Seller has already delivered such agreement at a prior Closing and such documentation remains in full force and effect; </P>
