<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
provided herein, to agree to, negotiate, enter into settlements and compromises of, and comply with orders of courts with respect to, such claims or losses, to waive any breach or default of STEP
or SSG of any obligation to be performed by STEP or SSG under this Agreement, to receive service of process on behalf of each Seller in connection with any claims against such Seller arising under or in connection with this Agreement, or any other
agreements, instruments, certificates and documents provided for hereby or any of the transactions contemplated hereby or under any other documents in connection with the Transactions, to take all other actions that are either (i)&nbsp;necessary or
appropriate in the judgment of the Asset Class&nbsp;Head for the accomplishment of the foregoing or (ii)&nbsp;specifically mandated by the terms of this Agreement. Notices or communications to or from the Asset Class&nbsp;Head shall constitute
notice to or from the Sellers. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, STEP and SSG are entitled to rely, without inquiry, upon any document delivered by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head as being genuine and correct and having been duly signed or
sent by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Changes to the Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>. The Person acting as Head of Real
Estate of SRE GP on the date of this Agreement shall initially be the Asset Class&nbsp;Head. In the event such Person ceases to be the Head of Real Estate of SRE GP, whether due to death, incapacity, resignation or otherwise, then in each case,
(i)&nbsp;such Person shall automatically cease to be the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, and (ii)&nbsp;the individual elected by the Majority Holders shall become the Asset Class&nbsp;Head for all purposes under this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Authority</U>. The grant of authority provided for in this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.16</U> is coupled with an interest, is being
granted, in part, as an inducement to STEP and SSG to enter into this Agreement and is in addition to the grant of authority provided in the Power of Attorneys, and (i)&nbsp;shall be irrevocable and survive the dissolution, liquidation or bankruptcy
of any party or the death, incompetency, liquidation or bankruptcy of any Seller, shall be binding on any successor thereto and (ii)&nbsp;shall survive the assignment by any Seller of the whole or any portion of his, her or its interest under this
Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) Each Seller hereby consents to the taking of any and all actions and the making of any decisions required or permitted to
be taken or made by Asset Class&nbsp;Head pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.16</U>. Each Seller agrees that the Asset Class&nbsp;Head shall have no obligation or liability to any Person for any action taken or omitted by her in good
faith, and each Seller shall indemnify and hold harmless the Asset Class&nbsp;Head from, and shall pay to the Asset Class&nbsp;Head the amount of, or reimburse the Asset Class&nbsp;Head for, any loss that the Asset Class&nbsp;Head may suffer,
sustain or become subject to as a result of any such action or omission by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head under this Agreement. The Asset Class&nbsp;Head may seek the advice of legal counsel in the event of any dispute or question as to the construction
of any of the provisions of this Agreement or her duties hereunder, and, without limiting the foregoing, shall incur no liability in his capacity as the Asset Class&nbsp;Head to the Sellers and shall be fully protected with respect to any action
taken, omitted or suffered by it in good faith in accordance with the advice of such counsel. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) Any expenses or liabilities incurred by
the Asset Class&nbsp;Head in connection with the performance of its duties under this Agreement or any other documents in connection with the Transactions shall not be the personal obligation of the Asset Class&nbsp;Head but shall be payable by the
Sellers. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 28 - </P>

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE X </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>DEFINITIONS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(c)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration Party</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(h)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjusted Holdback</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(f)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjustment Statement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Affiliate</U>&#148; means, with reference to a specified Person, any other Person that, directly or indirectly, through one or more
intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with, the specified Person. For purposes of this definition, the term &#147;control&#148; (including with correlative meanings, the terms &#147;controlling&#148;,
&#147;controlled by&#148;, and &#147;under common control with&#148;), with respect to any Person, means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of such Person, either
through the ownership of a majority of such Person&#146;s voting stock, by contract or otherwise. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148; has the
meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Aggregate Equity Limit</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.8(a)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Annual Exchange Schedule</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.1(a)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Antitrust Laws</U>&#148; means any antitrust, competition or trade regulation Laws
that are designed or intended to prohibit, restrict or regulate actions having the purpose or effect of monopolization or restraint of trade or lessening competition through merger or acquisition, including without limitation the HSR Act, the
Sherman Antitrust Act of 1890, the Clayton Act of 1914, the Federal Trade Commission Act of 1914, Council Regulation (EC) No 139/2004 of 20&nbsp;January 2004 on the control of concentrations between undertakings in the European Union. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Applicable Outside Date</U>&#148; means has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;8.1(b)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. </P>

in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;7.5</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>blocked person</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in

banks in New York, New York are authorized or obligated by applicable Law or executive order to close. </P>

claims and legal, administrative, arbitration or mediation or similar proceedings (whether sounding in contract, tort or otherwise, whether civil or criminal and whether brought at law or in equity). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Process</U>&#148; or &#147;<U>Processing</U>&#148; means the creation, collection, use (including for the purposes of sending
telephone calls, text messages and emails), storage, maintenance, processing, recording, distribution, transfer, transmission, receipt, import, export, protection, safeguarding, access, disposal or disclosure or other activity regarding data
(whether electronically or in any other form or medium). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Power of Attorney</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in

proportion obtained by dividing (i)&nbsp;the number of Equity Securities of SRE held by such Seller by (ii)&nbsp;the total number of Equity Securities of SRE held by all Sellers, determined in each case as of the Reference Date of such Exchange.

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SPD</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SPD Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>specially designated national</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;3.6(c)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SRE</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SRE GP</U>&#148; means StepStone Group Real Estate Holdings LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, which serves as the general
partner of SRE. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SRE GP Limited Liability Company Agreement</U>&#148; means the Second Amended and Restated Limited Liability
Company Agreement of SRE GP, dated as of October&nbsp;1, 2019. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SRE Limited Partnership Agreement</U>&#148; means the Fifth
Amended and Restated Limited Partnership Agreement of SRE, dated as of January&nbsp;1, 2024, and as applicable any amendment or replacement thereof from time to time. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 33 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SSG</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph of this
Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SSG Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;D Units</U>&#148; means a newly created class of equity units of SSG to be designated
Class&nbsp;D Units, having terms and rights substantially similar to the terms and rights applicable to the Class&nbsp;C Units of SSG. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SSG LPA</U>&#148; means Ninth Amended and Restated Limited Partnership Agreement of StepStone Group LP, dated September&nbsp;20,
2021, as the same may be further amended or restated from time to time in accordance with the terms thereof. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP</U>&#148; has
the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Audited Financials</U>&#148; has the meaning set
forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.2(a)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Board</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(i)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;A Common Stock</U>&#148; means the Class&nbsp;A Common
Stock of STEP, par value $0.001 per share (or any successor security of STEP). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Stockholder Approval</U>&#148; has the
meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;7.2(b)</U> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>StepStone</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the introductory
paragraph of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP</U>&#148; means, as of any date, the
arithmetic average (rounded to the nearest second decimal place) of the per share volume-weighted average price as displayed under the heading &#147;Bloomberg VWAP&#148; on Bloomberg page &#147;STEP &lt;equity&gt; AQR&#148; (or its equivalent
successor if such page is not available) or any successor security thereto, in respect of the period from the scheduled open of trading until the scheduled close of trading of the primary trading session on such Trading Day, on the trading market on
which STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock is primarily listed on and quoted for trading as reported by Bloomberg L.P. (or its successor) or, if not available, by Dow Jones&nbsp;&amp; Company Inc. (or its successor), or if neither is available, by another
authoritative source, for each of the thirty (30)&nbsp;consecutive Trading Days ending on and including the fifteenth (15th) Trading Day after the Reference Date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Tax</U>&#148; or &#147;<U>Taxes</U>&#148; means (a)&nbsp;any federal, state, local or foreign income, gross receipts, franchise,
estimated, alternative minimum, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">add-on</FONT> minimum, sales, use, transfer, real property gains, registration, value added, excise, natural resources, severance, stamp, occupation, premium, windfall profit,
environmental, customs, duties, real property, special assessment, personal property, capital stock, social security, unemployment, disability, payroll, license, employee or other withholding, or other tax, of any kind whatsoever, including any
interest, penalties or additions to tax or additional amounts in respect of the foregoing; (b)&nbsp;any liability for payment of amounts described in clause (a)&nbsp;whether as a result of transferee liability, of being a member of an affiliated,
consolidated, combined or unitary group for any period or otherwise through operation of law; and (c)&nbsp;any liability for the payment of amounts described in <U>clauses (a)</U>&nbsp;or <U>(b)</U> as a result of any tax sharing, tax receivable,
tax indemnity or tax allocation agreement or any other express or implied agreement to indemnify any other Person (other than any commercial agreement entered into in the ordinary course of business and the primary focus of which is not Tax). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 34 - </P>

</DIV></Center>

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Tax Receivable Agreement</U>&#148; means that certain Tax Receivable Agreement
(Exchanges), dated as of September&nbsp;18, 2020, by and among STEP, SSG, and each of the other persons and entities parties thereto. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Termination Acceleration Exchange</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Annex C</U> this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Trading Day</U>&#148; means a day on which (i)&nbsp;trading in the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or other security for which a
closing sale price must be determined) generally occurs on Nasdaq or, if the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is not then listed on Nasdaq, on the principal other U.S. national or regional securities exchange on which the STEP
Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is then listed or, if the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is not then listed on a U.S. national or regional securities exchange, on the principal other market on which the
STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is then traded and (ii)&nbsp;a last reported sale price for the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or closing sale price for such other security) is available on such securities exchange or
market; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, if the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is not so listed or traded, &#147;Trading Day&#148; means a Business Day. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Transaction</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Transfer</U>&#148;, including correlative terms, means, with respect to any Seller, any sale, conveyance, exchange, assignment,
pledge, encumbrance, gift, bequest, hypothecation or other transfer or disposition by any other means, of any or all of such Seller&#146;s shares of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or other economic interest in STEP), whether for value or no value
and whether directly or indirectly, voluntary or involuntary (including, without limitation, by operation of law), or an agreement to do any of the foregoing. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>UNSC</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;3.6(c)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Upward Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(c)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>willful and material breach</U>&#148; means has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;8.2(a)</U>. </P>

 <DIV ALIGN="right">

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>ANNEX A </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>Calculation of Exchange Value </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>General Definitions </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjusted Net Income</U>&#148; means adjusted net income, as such term is defined in STEP&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
measures as filed with the SEC from time to time or, if no such definition exists in STEP public filings, then such metric as defined in good faith by the STEP Board. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjusted Shares Outstanding</U>&#148; means a number of adjusted shares, calculated as of the Reference Date and not as a weighted-average over time,
using the methodology used to calculate Adjusted Weighted-Average Shares in STEP&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures as filed with the SEC from time to time or, if no such calculation of Adjusted Weighted-Average Shares
exists in STEP public filings, then such metric as defined in good faith by the STEP Board. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Applicable SRE Multiple</U>&#148; means, with
respect to an Exchange, a number calculated as of the Reference Date for such Exchange and equal to the STEP Multiple <I>multiplied by</I> (a) 65%, if the STEP Multiple equals 40, (b) 89%, if the STEP Multiple equals 16, and (c)&nbsp;a percentage
ratably based on (a)&nbsp;and (b), if the STEP Multiple is greater than 16 and less than 40. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Baseline Exchange Value</U>&#148; means an amount
equal to (a)&nbsp;the Exchange Value, <I>multiplied by</I> (b)&nbsp;the Participation Percentage. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Calculated SRE Value</U>&#148; means
(a)&nbsp;with respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange, (i)&nbsp;the SRE Budget ANI as of the Reference Date for such Exchange, <I>multiplied by</I> (ii)&nbsp;the Applicable SRE Multiple for such Exchange, and (b)&nbsp;with
respect to an Acceleration Exchange, (i)&nbsp;the Acceleration SRE Budget ANI as of the Reference Date for the Acceleration Exchange, <I>multiplied by</I> (ii)&nbsp;the Applicable SRE Multiple for such Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Exchange Value</U>&#148; for an Exchange means an amount equal to (a)&nbsp;the Calculated SRE Value, <I>multiplied by</I> (b)&nbsp;the aggregate
Equity Percentage represented by all Exchanged Units in such Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Forward ANI Multiple</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange, the
ratio of (a)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP, <I>multiplied by</I> (b)&nbsp;the total number of Adjusted Shares Outstanding on the Reference Date of such Exchange (for the avoidance of doubt, excluding any
Consideration Units to be issued as of such date), <I>divided by</I> (c)&nbsp;(i) with respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange, the STEP Budget ANI, or (ii)&nbsp;with respect to an Acceleration Exchange, the Acceleration STEP
Budget ANI. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SRE Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange, the budgeted Adjusted Net Income
of SRE, as prepared in good faith utilizing a consistent methodology as STEP and approved by the Board of Directors of SRE, for the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period beginning on the Reference Date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange, the budgeted Adjusted Net Income of STEP, as
approved by the STEP Board for the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period beginning on the Reference Date (for the avoidance of doubt, for purposes of calculating the Exchange </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Value of any Exchange, the STEP Budget ANI as applied shall be calculated assuming the Exchanged Units for such Exchange have not yet been acquired by STEP and, accordingly, shall not reflect any
pro forma adjustment for the acquisition of such Exchanged Units). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Multiple</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange, a number
calculated as of the Reference Date for such Exchange and equal to the Forward ANI Multiple; provided, that such multiple shall not be greater than 40. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>Acceleration Exchange Definitions </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration </U><U>SRE Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Acceleration Exchange, the budgeted Adjusted Net Income of SRE, as prepared in
good faith utilizing a consistent methodology as STEP and approved by the GP Board, for the Initial Projection Year; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that in calculating such amount, the Performance Fee Related Earnings of SRE for the Initial
Projection Year shall be the Average Performance Fee Related Earnings of SRE. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration STEP Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an
Acceleration Exchange, the budgeted Adjusted Net Income of STEP, as approved by the STEP Board, for the Initial Projection Year (for the avoidance of doubt, for purposes of calculating the Exchange Value of any Acceleration Exchange, the STEP Budget
ANI as applied shall be calculated assuming the Exchanged Units for such Acceleration Exchange have not yet been acquired by STEP and, accordingly, shall not reflect any pro forma adjustment for the acquisition of such Exchanged Units);
<U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that in calculating such amount, the Performance Fee Related Earnings of STEP for the Initial Projection Year shall be the Average Performance Fee Related Earnings of STEP. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Actual Acceleration SRE ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Acceleration Exchange, the actual Adjusted Net Income of SRE used to prepare the STEP
Audited Financials for the Initial Projection Year; provided, however, that in calculating such amount, the Performance Fee Related Earnings of SRE for the Initial Projection Year shall be replaced with the Average Performance Fee Related Earnings
of SRE. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Average Performance Fee Related Earnings</U>&#148; means the average of the Performance Fee Related Earnings for (i)&nbsp;the Initial
Projection Year, (ii)&nbsp;the Second Projection Year and (iii)&nbsp;the Final Projection Year. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Final Projection Year</U>&#148; means the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period starting immediately after the end of the Second Projection Year. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Initial Projection
Year</U>&#148; means, for an Acceleration Exchange, the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period beginning on the Reference Date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Performance Fee Related Earnings</U>&#148; means the performance related revenue (including performance related fee revenue, incentive fee revenue
and carried interest) less performance fee related compensation expense. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Second Projection Year</U>&#148; means the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period
starting immediately after the end of the Initial Projection Year. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE B </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>Annual Exchange Schedule<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP> </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<P STYLE="line-height:1.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.50pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>TRANSACTION AGREEMENT </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>by and among </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>STEPSTONE

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.8</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP>Limitations on Exchanges</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">8</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.9</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP>Extension of Exchanges</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">9</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="3"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">

&#150; Calculation of Exchange Value </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annex B</U> &#150; Required Regulatory Approvals </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedules: </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule A</U> &#150; Seller Exchange Schedule </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule
B</U> &#150; Annual Exchange Schedule </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule C</U> &#150; Schedule of Sellers </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibits</U>: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibit A</U> &#150; Form of Exchange
Agreement </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibit B</U> &#150; Form of Registration Rights Agreement </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">-iii- </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>TRANSACTION AGREEMENT </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">This TRANSACTION AGREEMENT (this &#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;), dated as of February 7, 2024, is by and among StepStone Group Inc., a Delaware
corporation (&#147;<U>STEP</U>&#148;), StepStone Group LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#147;<U>SSG</U>&#148;, and together with STEP, &#147;<U>StepStone</U>&#148;), StepStone Group Real Assets LP, a Delaware limited partnership
(&#147;<U>SIRA</U>&#148;), James O&#146;Leary, solely in his capacity as the representative of the Sellers under this Agreement (the &#147;<U>Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;), and each equityholder of SIRA identified as a Seller on
<U>Schedule C</U> attached hereto (each, a &#147;<U>Seller</U>&#148;, and collectively, the &#147;<U>Sellers</U>&#148;, and together with STEP, SSG, SIRA, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, each a &#147;<U>Party</U>&#148; and collectively, the
&#147;<U>Parties</U>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>RECITALS </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>to support the ongoing operational integration of business practices and to enhance client and staff experiences at
StepStone and SIRA, the Parties desire to enter into this Transaction Agreement to facilitate the medium to long-term economic integration of the Parties; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>in furtherance of the purposes in the foregoing recital, the Parties intend for the Sellers to exchange, in a series of
transactions, the Sellers&#146; equity interests in SIRA for equity interests in SSG (or cash in lieu of a portion thereof) (collectively, the &#147;<U>Transactions</U>&#148;, and each such exchange, an &#147;<U>Exchange</U>&#148;); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, substantially concurrently with the execution and delivery of this Agreement, StepStone has separately entered into (i)&nbsp;a
transaction agreement (the &#147;<U>SRE Transaction Agreement</U>&#148;) with StepStone Group Real Estate LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#147;<U>SRE</U>&#148;), certain equityholders of SRE parties thereto (the &#147;<U>SRE Sellers</U>&#148;)
and the seller representative of SRE (the &#147;<U>SRE Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;a transaction agreement (the &#147;<U>SPD Transaction Agreement</U>&#148;) with Swiss Capital Alternative Investments AG, a private
company limited by shares incorporated in the canton of Zurich (&#147;<U>SPD</U>&#148;), SC Partner LP, a Cayman Islands exempted limited partnership (the &#147;<U>SPD Seller</U>&#148;), the seller representative of SPD (the &#147;<U>SPD Asset
Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;) and StepStone Europe Limited, a private limited liability company incorporated in England; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, subject to the terms and conditions in this Agreement, including with respect to any Acceleration Exchange, Termination
Acceleration Exchange and Change of Control Exchange (each as defined below), the Parties intend to consummate ten (10)&nbsp;annual Exchanges, or up to fifteen (15)&nbsp;annual Exchanges as set forth herein, with the first Exchange to be conducted
with a reference date of April&nbsp;1, 2024 (the &#147;<U>Initial Reference Date</U>&#148;) and to be consummated promptly following the Initial Reference Date upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in this Agreement applicable
to such Exchange, and the subsequent Exchanges to be conducted with a reference date of each of the next succeeding anniversaries of the Initial Reference Date (such dates, together with the Initial Reference Date, each, a &#147;<U>Reference
Date</U>&#148;) and to be consummated promptly following each applicable Reference Date upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in this Agreement applicable to such Exchanges; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>the Parties intend that, at the consummation of the last Exchange or the Acceleration Exchange (as defined below), SSG
will own one hundred percent (100%) of all the outstanding equity interests of SIRA currently not owned by SSG; and </P> <P STYLE="font-size:18pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, as a condition and inducement to STEP and SSG to enter into this Agreement
and as a condition to each Closing, each Seller desires to, by executing this Agreement, enter into a Power of Attorney (as defined below) in the form attached hereto as <U>Annex D</U>, appointing the Asset Class&nbsp;Head and any other Person or
Persons referred to therein, and each of them, as such Seller&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">attorneys-in-fact</FONT></FONT> with authority to act on behalf of such Seller in connection with the
Transactions, and each Seller, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, and SIRA agree to use best efforts to deliver SSG and STEP a duly executed, witnessed, accepted by the principal and notarized (in each case, to the extent required by applicable Laws) Power
of Attorney as promptly as possible (and in any event within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days of this Agreement). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B>, in
consideration of the foregoing and the mutual representations, warranties, covenants and agreements set forth herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, and intending to be legally
bound hereby, the parties hereby agree as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE I </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>THE EXCHANGE </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.1 <U>The
Exchange</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Upon the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement, at each Closing (as defined below), each Participating
Seller (as defined below) shall sell, convey, assign, transfer and deliver to SSG, and SSG shall purchase, acquire and accept from each Seller, all of such Seller&#146;s right, title and interest in and to such amount of Equity Securities of SIRA in
accordance with the principles set forth on Schedule A attached hereto (the &#147;<U>Seller Exchange Schedule</U>&#148;); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head may modify the Seller Exchange Schedule no later than ten
(10)&nbsp;days prior to the Reference Date of such Exchange with the prior written approval by the GP Board (unless such modifications are consistent with the methodology stated in the Seller Exchange Schedule and reflect only changes in ownership
due to transfers among the Sellers or other active employees of SIRA, in which case the written approval of the GP Board is not required); <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, <U>that</U>, in the event the Seller Exchange Schedule is substantially
modified by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, the Asset Class&nbsp;head shall, in good faith, notify and consult with the Sellers regarding the changes in circumstances relating to any such modification; <U>provided</U>, <U>further</U>, that, any such
modification shall not change the aggregate amount of Equity Securities of SIRA being exchanged in such Exchange, which shall, in the aggregate, equal the amount of Equity Securities of SIRA set forth on <U>Schedule B</U> attached hereto (the
&#147;<U>Annual Exchange Schedule</U>&#148;) opposite the Reference Date of such Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, (i)&nbsp;any Equity Securities of SIRA exchanged pursuant to this Agreement may be referred to as the &#147;<U>Exchanged
Units</U>&#148;; (ii) any Seller who participates in an Exchange may be referred to as a &#147;<U>Participating Seller</U>&#148; for purposes of such Exchange; and (iii)&nbsp;a &#147;<U>Participation Percentage</U>&#148; with respect a Participating
Seller in an Exchange shall mean a percentage representing (x)&nbsp;the Exchanged Units delivered by such Participating Seller in such Exchange <I>divided by</I><I> </I>(y)&nbsp;the aggregate Exchanged Units delivered by all Participating Sellers in
such Exchange. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 2 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) In exchange therefor, at each Closing (except with respect to an Acceleration Exchange,
which shall be governed by <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6</U>), SSG shall convey to each Participating Seller such Participating Seller&#146;s Individual Exchange Value by (i)&nbsp;delivering to such Participating Seller an amount in cash equal
to (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Baseline Value <I>multiplied by</I> the Cash Election Percentage with respect to such Participating Seller for such Exchange as determined pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>, <I>plus</I> (y)&nbsp;the Fractional
Unit Payment, and (ii)&nbsp;issuing to such Participating Seller the number of whole SSG Class&nbsp;D Units (rounded down to the nearest whole SSG Class&nbsp;D Unit) equal to (x)&nbsp;(A) the Individual Exchange Value <I>less</I> (B)&nbsp;the cash
amount delivered pursuant to the foregoing clause (i)(x), <I>divided by</I> (y)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP. Any SSG Class&nbsp;D Units issued by SSG to the Sellers pursuant to his Agreement may be referred to
herein as the &#147;<U>Consideration Units</U>&#148;. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) At each Closing, each Participating Seller shall also convey, assign, transfer
and deliver to SSG all of such Participating Seller&#146;s right, title and interest in and to a number of membership interests of SIRA GP, for no additional consideration, equal to (i)&nbsp;such Participating Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage
in such Exchange <I>multiplied by </I>(ii)&nbsp;the number of total issued and outstanding membership interests of SIRA GP <I>multiplied by </I>(iii)&nbsp;the Equity Percentage with respect to such Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) In lieu of the issuance of any fractional SSG Class&nbsp;D Unit, any Seller who would otherwise have been entitled to a fraction of a SSG
Class&nbsp;D Unit pursuant to the terms of this Agreement shall be paid cash, without interest (the &#147;<U>Fractional Unit Payment</U>&#148;), in an amount equal to (i)&nbsp;the fractional SSG Class&nbsp;D Unit to which such Seller would otherwise
be entitled under <U>Article I</U> of this Agreement <I>multiplied by</I> (ii)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP, and rounded to the nearest cent. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.2 <U>Closing</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) The
closing of any Exchange (each a &#147;<U>Closing</U>&#148;) shall take place remotely via electronic exchange of documents and signatures, as promptly as practicable following, but in no event later than, the third (3<SUP
STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">rd</SUP>) Business Day after the satisfaction or waiver of each of the conditions set forth in <U>Article II</U> of this Agreement applicable to such Closing (other than, but subject to satisfaction of, the
conditions to be satisfied on the applicable Closing Date); <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, in no event shall a Closing take place prior to the first (1<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">st</SUP>) Business Day after the latest of
(i)&nbsp;the last day of the determination period for the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP for such Exchange, (ii)&nbsp;the date on which STEP issues its audited financial statements for its latest fiscal year ending prior to
the Closing (the &#147;<U>STEP Audited Financials</U>&#148;), and (iii)&nbsp;the date on which the Adjustment Statement is delivered in respect of the preceding Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, the date of the Closing with respect to an
Exchange may be referred to as the &#147;<U>Closing Date</U>&#148; of such Exchange, and the effective time of the Closing with respect to an Exchange may be referred as the &#147;<U>Effective Time</U>&#148; of such Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) The failure to consummate an Exchange on the date and time determined pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.2(a)</U> shall not
result in the termination of this Agreement or relieve any Party of any of its obligations under this Agreement. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 3 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.3 <U>Cash Election</U>. For each Exchange other than the first Exchange, the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head may deliver to SSG a notice (a &#147;<U>Cash Election Notice</U>&#148;) setting forth a percentage of the Reduced Baseline Value of such Exchange to be settled in cash for each Participating Seller (such percentage, the &#147;<U>Cash
Election Percentage</U>&#148;); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, for the first Exchange, the Cash Election Percentage for each Participating Seller shall be ten percent (10%) (except as otherwise designated by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head and notified to
SSG within ten (10)&nbsp;days of this Agreement); <U>provided</U>, <U>further</U>, in no event shall the aggregate cash settlement amount to be paid in the first Exchange exceed ten percent (10%) of the Baseline Exchange Value of the first Exchange,
and in no event shall the aggregate cash settlement amount to be paid in any subsequent Exchange exceed twenty percent (20%) of the Reduced Baseline Value of such Exchange; <U>provided</U>, <U>further</U>, that upon the request of the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head, SSG shall consider in good faith increasing such permitted cash settlement amount if the Sellers would experience materially greater aggregate tax liability in one or more Exchanges than previously anticipated. Each Cash Election
Notice shall be delivered by May&nbsp;1 of the year prior to the Reference Date of such Exchange. In the event that no Cash Election Notice is properly and timely delivered for an Exchange, the Cash Election Percentage for each Participating Seller
shall be deemed to be zero with respect to such Exchange. Upon receipt of a Cash Election Notice properly and timely delivered, subject to the restrictions under applicable Law, any governance documents of STEP and SSG, and any credit agreement,
loan agreement, note, indenture or other financing agreements under which STEP or SSG is bound, and subject to the receipt of any applicable stockholder or regulatory approval, SSG, at its sole discretion, shall use commercially reasonable efforts
to deliver, or cause to be delivered, the cash portion of the Baseline Exchange Value (or, for each Exchange other than the first Exchange, the Reduced Baseline Value); <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, to the extent SSG does not deliver, or cause to be
delivered, all or a portion of such cash consideration, the cash portion shall be reduced and, consequently, the number of Consideration Units deliverable shall be increased. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.4 <U>Distribution Adjustments</U>. It is intended that any distributions made by SIRA in respect of the Exchanged Units with respect to any
period ending prior to the Reference Date for an Exchange will inure to the benefit of the Participating Sellers; and that the Consideration Units issued in such Exchange shall entitle the Participating Sellers to receive any distributions made by
SSG with respect to any period commencing on or after the applicable Reference Date. In the event any such distributions are paid or made to a Person in a manner inconsistent with such intent, then the Parties shall make appropriate adjustments
(i)&nbsp;to the consideration delivered in such Exchange or in the subsequent Exchanges or (ii)&nbsp;to distributions or other payments made by SSG with respect to the Consideration Units after the applicable Reference Date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.5 <U><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">True-Up</FONT></U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Adjustment Statement</U>. As soon as practicable, but in no event later than ten (10)&nbsp;days after each issuance of the STEP Audited
Financials, SSG shall deliver to the Asset Class&nbsp;Head a statement (an &#147;<U>Adjustment Statement</U>&#148;) setting forth SSG&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-calculation</FONT> of the Exchange Value of the last Exchange by
applying the Applicable SIRA Multiple as of the preceding Reference Date to the actual Adjusted Net Income of SIRA (rather than SIRA Budget ANI) used to prepare the STEP Audited Financials (such recalculated amount, the &#147;<U>Final Exchange
Value</U>&#148;). An &#147;<U>Upward Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between (w)&nbsp;the Final Exchange Value and (x)&nbsp;the Exchange Value originally calculated and used for such Exchange
(the &#147;<U>Original Exchange Value</U>&#148;); and a &#147;<U>Downward Adjustment </U><U>Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between (y)&nbsp;the Original Exchange Value and (z)&nbsp;the Final Exchange
Value. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 4 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Upward Adjustment</U>. If an Upward Adjustment Amount exists, then in the current
year Exchange, (i)&nbsp;for any Person who is a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, the Individual Exchange Value to be delivered to such Person shall equal (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Baseline Value to be delivered to such Person in such
Exchange <I>plus</I> (y)&nbsp;the product of (A)&nbsp;the Upward Adjustment Amount<I> multiplied by</I> (B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Exchange for which the Adjustment Statement is provided (the &#147;<U>Original
Exchange</U>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;for any Person who was a Participating Seller in the Original Exchange but is not a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, then at the Closing of the current year Exchange (or if the Original Exchange
is the final Exchange for such Person, then as soon as practicable following the date on which STEP issues the STEP Audited Financials for the current year Exchange), SSG shall (x)&nbsp;issue such Person an additional amount of Consideration Units
(rounded down to the nearest whole Consideration Unit) equal to (A)&nbsp;the Upward Adjustment Amount<I> multiplied by</I> (B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, <I>divided by</I> (C)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP, and (y)&nbsp;pay such Person an amount of cash equal to the Fractional Unit Payment. For the avoidance of doubt, any reference to Upward Adjustment Amount in this paragraph shall be a reference to the
Upward Adjustment Amount with respect to the Original Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Downward Adjustment</U>. If a Downward Adjustment Amount exists,
then in the current year Exchange, (i)&nbsp;for any Person who is a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Baseline Value to be delivered to such Person shall be reduced by an amount equal to the product of
(A)&nbsp;the Downward Adjustment Amount <I>multiplied by</I> (B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, and (y)&nbsp;the Individual Exchange Value to be delivered to such Person shall equal the Reduced Baseline
Value as adjusted by the foregoing <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)(i)(x)</U>, (ii) for any Person who was a Participating Seller in the Original Exchange but is not a Participating Seller in the current year Exchange, then, at SSG&#146;s
option, (x)&nbsp;such Person shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount of cash equal to (A)&nbsp;the Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by </I>(B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the
Original Exchange, or (y)&nbsp;an amount equal to (A)&nbsp;the Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by </I>(B)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, shall be carried forward to the next succeeding future
Exchange(s) participated by such Person. To the extent the Individual Exchange Value would fall below zero as a result of an adjustment pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>, then, at SSG&#146;s option, (1)&nbsp;any Person who
was a Participating Seller in the Original Exchange shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount in cash equal to (x)&nbsp;the remaining Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by </I>(y)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s
Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, or (2)&nbsp;an amount equal to (x)&nbsp;the remaining Downward Adjustment Amount, <I>multiplied by </I>(y)&nbsp;such Person&#146;s Participation Percentage in the Original Exchange, shall be carried
forward to the next succeeding future Exchange(s) participated by such Person. To the extent any remaining balance of the applicable portion of any Downward Adjustment Amount exists immediately after the Closing of the final Exchange with respect to
a Seller, such Seller shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount in cash equal to such remaining balance. Each Seller acknowledges and agrees that, in the event that a Seller does not timely pay SSG any cash
amount payable by such Seller to SSG pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>, SSG shall have the right to set off such cash amount against any dividends, distributions or other income allocations from SSG or its Affiliates to such
Seller or its Affiliates and against any other amounts (including, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 5 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
employment compensation and expense reimbursements) otherwise payable by SSG or its Affiliates to such Seller or its Affiliates. For the avoidance of doubt, any reference to Downward Adjustment
Amount in this paragraph shall be a reference to the Downward Adjustment Amount with respect to the Original Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.6
<U>Acceleration Exchange</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Acceleration Exchange</U>. At any point following the Exchange with respect to the April&nbsp;1,
2028 Reference Date, the Majority Holders and SSG may, by mutual agreement, elect to accelerate the remaining annual Exchanges in one final Exchange as of the Reference Date immediately following such election. Each Seller agrees that in the event
the Majority Holders and SSG so elect to accelerate the remaining annual Exchanges, the Majority Holders and SSG may, in their sole discretion, require each Seller to sell and surrender all Equity Securities of SIRA held by such Seller in such final
Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, such final Exchange may be referred to as the &#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange</U>&#148;. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b)
<U>Holdback</U>. At the Closing of the Acceleration Exchange, Consideration Units representing fifty percent (50%) of the Reduced Baseline Value (the &#147;<U>Holdback</U>&#148;) shall not be issued by SSG but shall instead be held back to
facilitate a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">true-up</FONT> following the issuance of the STEP Audited Financials for the Final Projection Year (it being understood that, without limiting the provisions set forth in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>, the Cash Election Percentage for such Acceleration Exchange shall not exceed fifty percent (50%) for any Seller). For the avoidance of doubt, the Holdback shall not include any cash consideration included in
the Reduced Baseline Value. SSG shall pay to the Participating Sellers (in proportion to their respective Participation Percentages for such Acceleration Exchange) an amount equal to all dividends, distributions (including tax distributions) and
other income with respect to fifty percent (50%) of the unissued Consideration Units included in the Holdback, which payment shall be made at the same time as such dividends, distributions and other income are distributed or paid to the other
partners of SSG generally in accordance with the terms of the SSG LPA; SSG shall pay to the Participating Sellers (in proportion to their respective Participation Percentages for such Acceleration Exchange) an amount equal to all dividends,
distributions and other income with respect to the other fifty percent (50%) of the unissued Consideration Units included in the Holdback, which payment shall be made at such time as, and to the extent, the Participating Sellers become entitled to
such Consideration Units. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement</U>. As soon as practicable, but in no event later than ten
(10)&nbsp;days after the issuance of the STEP Audited Financials for the Final Projection Year, SSG shall deliver to the Asset Class&nbsp;Head a statement (the &#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement</U>&#148;) setting forth SSG&#146;s <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-calculation</FONT> of the Exchange Value of the Acceleration Exchange by applying the Applicable SIRA Multiple as of the Reference Date of the Acceleration Exchange to the Actual Acceleration SIRA ANI (rather than
Acceleration SIRA Budget ANI) (such recalculated amount, the &#147;<U>Final Acceleration Exchange Value</U>&#148;). An &#147;<U>Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference
between the Final Acceleration Exchange Value and the Exchange Value originally calculated and used for the Acceleration Exchange (the &#147;<U>Original Acceleration Exchange Value</U>&#148;); and a &#147;<U>Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment
Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between the Original Acceleration Exchange Value and the Final Acceleration Exchange Value. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 6 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) <U>No Adjustment</U>. If the Final Acceleration Exchange Value equals the Original
Acceleration Exchange Value, SSG shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of the date of determination of the Final Acceleration Exchange Value) release the Holdback to each Participating Seller in proportion to such
Participating Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) <U>Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment</U>. Upon the delivery of the
Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement, if an Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount exists, SSG shall promptly deliver to each Participating Seller in such Acceleration Exchange (i)&nbsp;such Participating Seller&#146;s Participation
Percentage of amounts in the Holdback, (ii)&nbsp;cash equal to the Fractional Unit Payment, and (iii)&nbsp;a number of issued Consideration Units (rounded down to the nearest whole Consideration Unit) equal to (x)&nbsp;such Participating
Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage of the Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount (net of any Downward Adjustment carried forward pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>) <I>divided by</I> (y)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(f) <U>Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment</U>. Upon the delivery of the
Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement, if a Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount exists, SSG shall (i)&nbsp;retain for SSG&#146;s account from the Holdback an amount equal to the Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount
(together with all dividends, distributions and other income with respect to the relevant unissued Consideration Units) (the remaining Holdback after such deduction, the &#147;<U>Adjusted Holdback</U>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;following the completion
of step (i), promptly release the Adjusted Holdback, if any, to each Participating Seller in proportion to such Participating Seller&#146;s Participation Percentage for such Acceleration Exchange, in each case net of any Downward Adjustment for such
Participating Seller carried forward pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(g) <U>Further Adjustment</U>. In the event
the Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount exceeds the Exchange Value of the Holdback, each Seller shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount in cash equal to (i)&nbsp;such Participating Seller&#146;s
Participation Percentage of (ii)&nbsp;(x) the Downward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount <I>less</I> (y)&nbsp;the Exchange Value of the Holdback. Each Seller acknowledges and agrees that, in the event that a Seller does not timely pay SSG any
cash amount payable by such Seller to SSG pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(g)</U>, SSG shall have the right to set off such cash amount against any dividends, distributions or other income allocations from SSG or its Affiliates to
such Seller or its Affiliates and against any other amounts (including, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, employment compensation and expense reimbursements) otherwise payable by SSG or its Affiliates to such Seller or its Affiliates. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(h) <U>Termination Acceleration Exchange</U>. With respect to any Seller who is terminated (with or without cause), resigns or retires (an
&#147;<U>Acceleration Party</U>&#148;), such Seller&#146;s remaining Equity Securities in SIRA shall be treated as set forth in <U>Annex C</U> attached hereto. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) <U>Change of Control Exchange</U>. If a Change of Control of STEP or SSG shall occur, then the Exchanges provided for herein shall
continue as scheduled; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>: </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 7 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) the STEP Multiple for all Exchanges occurring on or after the date of the Change of
Control shall be the lower of (x) 40 and (y)&nbsp;the STEP Multiple implied by the fair value (as determined in good faith by the Board of Directors of STEP (the &#147;<U>STEP Board</U>&#148;)) of the consideration paid in such Change of Control for
each share of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or unit of SSG, as applicable; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(i)(i)</U> shall be subject to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.8</U>, and the provisions relating
to Skipped Exchanges shall apply, if the applicable STEP Multiple as determined in accordance with the foregoing is below 16; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) for
the purposes of subsequent calculations of the Exchange Value, the Exchange Value shall be calculated based on the fair value (as determined in good faith by the STEP Board) of the consideration paid in such Change of Control for each share of STEP
Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or unit of SSG, as applicable; and </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:13%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iii) the Exchange Value to be delivered to each Participating Seller for
Exchanges occurring on or after the effective date of the Change of Control shall be payable in the kind of securities, cash or other property paid in such Change of Control to other equityholders of STEP or SSG (such securities, cash or other
property, the &#147;<U>Reference Property</U>&#148; and the amount and kind of Reference Property that a holder of one Consideration Unit would be entitled to receive, a &#147;<U>Reference Property Unit</U>&#148;); provided, that, (x)&nbsp;if the
Reference Property consists of more than a single type of consideration to be determined based in part upon any form of equityholder election, then the composition of the Reference Property Unit shall be deemed to be the weighted average of the
types and amounts actually received by the other equityholders of STEP or SSG in the Change of Control transaction, and (y)&nbsp;if the Reference Property consists of equity securities that are not Publicly Traded Securities, STEP and SSG shall use
commercially reasonable efforts, acting in good faith, to structure the Change of Control transaction to avoid a disproportionate and materially adverse effect on the Sellers relative to the other equityholders of STEP or SSG party to such Change of
Control transaction. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.7 <U>Adjustment for Reclassification</U>. If the number of outstanding Equity Securities of STEP, SSG or SIRA have
been changed into a different number of units or a different class (including by reason of any reclassification, unit split (including a reverse unit split), recapitalization, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">split-up,</FONT> combination, exchange
of units, readjustment or other similar transaction), or if a unit dividend or unit distribution thereon is declared, the relevant provisions of this Agreement shall be equitably adjusted to reflect such change so as to provide SSG and Sellers the
same economic effect as contemplated by this Agreement prior to such event; <U>provided</U>, that nothing in this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.7</U> shall be deemed to permit or authorize SIRA to effect any such change that it is not authorized
or permitted to undertake. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.8 <U>Limitations on Exchanges</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Notwithstanding the other provisions of this <U>Article I</U>, none of the Sellers shall be obligated to effect any Exchange if the STEP
Multiple with respect to such Exchange is below 16 (such Exchange, a &#147;<U>Skipped Exchange</U>&#148;). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 8 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) Notwithstanding the provisions of this <U>Article I</U>, neither STEP nor SSG shall be
obligated to effect any Exchange if, after giving effect to such Exchange, STEP and/or SSG would have issued, pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and/or the Other Transaction Agreements, more than an aggregate of 75&nbsp;million Consideration
Units and/or Consideration Securities (as such term is defined in each Other Transaction Agreement) (the &#147;<U>Aggregate Equity Limit</U>&#148;). To the extent an Exchange would otherwise result in the issuance of Consideration Units in excess of
the Aggregate Equity Limit, STEP or SSG may, at its option and in its sole discretion, (i)&nbsp;increase the Cash Election Percentage for such Exchange (notwithstanding the cap set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>) so as to complete
such Exchange without exceeding the Aggregate Equity Limit, or (ii)&nbsp;increase the Aggregate Equity Limit; provided, that, upon the request of the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, STEP and/or SSG shall consider in good faith using its commercially
reasonable efforts to effectuate the foregoing clause (ii) (and failing that, the foregoing clause (i)). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) For the avoidance of doubt,
no Closing shall occur with respect to a Skipped Exchange and Sellers shall not be required to sell, convey or deliver Equity Securities of SIRA in connection with such Skipped Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) In the event of a Skipped Exchange, the Exchanged Units that would otherwise have been subject to such Exchange (i)&nbsp;shall be subject
to the next annual Exchange for which the STEP Multiple is equal to or greater than 16 or the Aggregate Equity Limit has not been exceeded, as applicable, (ii)&nbsp;the Exchange Value for such Exchanged Units shall be calculated using the actual
Adjusted Net Income of SIRA (rather than SIRA Budget ANI) for the fiscal year that was the subject of the Skipped Exchange and (iii)&nbsp;no <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">true-up</FONT> pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5</U> shall be
made with respect to such Exchanged Units. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.9 <U>Extension of Exchanges</U>. During the period from and after the Closing of the fifth
annual Exchange until thirty (30)&nbsp;calendar days after the Closing of the fifth annual Exchange, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head may, at his option on one occasion, deliver to SSG a notice (the &#147;<U>Extension Notice</U>&#148;) to the effect that
the Sellers irrevocably elect to increase the remaining number of annual Exchanges from five (5)&nbsp;to ten (10), and which Extension Notice shall be accompanied by a revised Annual Exchange Schedule that shall reflect such increase and a reduction
from 5.0% per year to 2.5% in the corresponding amount of Equity Securities of SIRA applicable to all future Exchanges (<U>provided</U>, that the foregoing remains subject to the election to trigger an Acceleration Exchange in accordance with
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6</U>). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE II </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>CONDITIONS TO EACH CLOSING </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2.1 <U>Conditions to All Parties</U><U>&#146;</U><U> Obligations to Close</U>. The obligations of SSG and STEP, on the one hand, and of the
Sellers, on the other hand, to complete any Closing contemplated by this Agreement are subject to the fulfillment at or prior to such Closing of each of the following conditions (any or all of which may be waived in whole or in part with respect to
the Sellers by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head): </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Required Regulatory Approvals</U>. The authorizations, consents, orders or approvals
of, or declarations or filings with, and the expirations or terminations of waiting periods required from, any Governmental Authorities set forth in <U>Annex B</U> attached hereto, with respect to this Agreement, the Transactions, and the relevant
Exchange (all such permits, approvals, filings and consents and the expiration or termination of all such waiting periods being referred to as the &#147;<U>Required Regulatory Approvals</U>&#148;), and all such Required Regulatory Approvals shall be
in full force and effect. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 9 - </P>

</DIV></Center>
