 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">or to such other Person or address as any party shall specify by notice in writing delivered pursuant to the
requirement set forth in this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.2</U> to the other Party. All such notices, requests, demands, waivers and communications shall be deemed to have been given (i)&nbsp;on the date on which so hand-delivered, (ii)&nbsp;on
the fifth (5<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">th</SUP>) Business Day following the date on which so mailed and (iii)&nbsp;on the date on which the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">E-mail</FONT> is confirmed, except for a notice of
change of address, which shall be effective only upon receipt thereof. For purposes of determining the date of delivery and receipt, the delivery or receipt of the copy of notices to outside legal counsel shall be irrelevant. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.3 <U>Annexes, Exhibits</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;and Schedules</U>. Any matter, information or item in any Annexes, Exhibits and Schedules attached
hereto are hereby incorporated in and made a part of this Agreement as if set forth herein. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.4 <U>Amendment, Modification and
Waiver</U>. This Agreement or any portion thereof, including any Annexes and Exhibits, may be amended, modified or supplemented by written agreement signed by STEP, SSG and the Asset Class&nbsp;Head; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, to the extent that
any such amendment, supplement or modification would materially adversely affect the rights or obligations the Sellers under this Agreement, such amendment, supplement or modification may only be made with the prior written consent of the Majority
Holders; <U>provided further</U>, <U>that</U>, to the extent any such amendment, supplement or modification would materially adversely and disproportionately affect the rights or obligations of any particular Seller or category of Sellers under this
Agreement as compared to other Sellers generally, such amendment, supplement or modification may only be made with the prior written consent of such Seller or a majority in interest of the Sellers that would be so adversely and disproportionately
affected; <U>provided further</U>, <U>that</U>, any such amendment, supplement or modification to the definition of &#147;Engaging in Competitive Behavior&#148; set forth on <U>Annex C</U> attached hereto may only be made with the prior written
consent of each Party hereto. Any failure of the Sellers or the Asset Class&nbsp;Head to comply with any term or provision of this Agreement may be waived by SSG or STEP, and any failure of SSG or STEP to comply with any term or provision of this
Agreement may be waived by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head (on behalf of himself and the Sellers), at any time by an instrument in writing signed by or on behalf of such other party, but such waiver shall not operate as a waiver of, or estoppel with
respect to, any subsequent or other failure to comply. Further, neither the waiver by any of the parties hereto of a breach of or a default under any of the provisions of this Agreement, nor the failure by any of the parties, on one or more
occasions, to enforce any of the provisions of this Agreement or to exercise any right or privilege hereunder, shall be construed as a waiver of any other breach or default of a similar nature, or as a waiver of any such provisions, rights or
privileges hereunder. Each Seller agrees that, to the extent all or a portion of this Agreement is amended, modified, supplemented or waived pursuant to the terms of this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.4</U>, such amendment, modification,
supplement or waiver shall be binding on such Seller, regardless of whether such Seller provided consent to such amendment, modification, supplement or waiver (except if such consent is expressly required pursuant to this
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.4)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.5 <U>Entire Agreement</U>. This Agreement, and the annexes, exhibits, schedules and other
documents referred to herein which form a part hereof contain the entire understanding of the parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof. This Agreement supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, oral and written, with respect
to its subject matter. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 24 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.6 <U>Severability</U>. Whenever possible, each provision or portion of any provision of
this Agreement shall be interpreted in such manner as to be effective and valid. If any term or other provision of this Agreement for any reason is declared invalid, illegal or unenforceable, such decision shall not affect the validity or
enforceability of any of the other provisions of this Agreement, which other provisions shall remain in full force and effect and the application of such invalid or unenforceable provision to Persons or circumstances other than those as to which it
is held invalid, illegal or unenforceable shall be valid and be enforced to the fullest extent permitted by applicable Law. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.7
<U>Binding Effect; Assignment</U>. Neither this Agreement nor any of the rights, interests or obligations under this Agreement may be assigned or delegated, in whole or in part, by operation of Law or otherwise, by any Party without the prior
written consent of SSG or STEP (in the case of an assignment by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head or a Seller) or the Asset Class&nbsp;Head (in the case of an assignment by SSG or STEP), and any such assignment without such prior written consent shall be
null and void; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that SSG and STEP each may assign in whole or a part of this Agreement to any Affiliate without the prior consent of any other Party to this Agreement; <U>provided further</U>, that no assignment shall
limit the assignor&#146;s obligations or liabilities hereunder. Subject to the preceding sentence, this Agreement will be binding upon, inure to the benefit of, and be enforceable by, the Parties and their respective successors and assigns. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.8 <U>No Third-Party Beneficiaries</U>. This Agreement is for the sole benefit of the Parties to this Agreement and their permitted
successors and assigns and nothing in this Agreement, express or implied, is intended to or shall confer upon any other Person or entity any legal or equitable right, benefit or remedy of any nature whatsoever, including any rights of employment for
any specified period, under or by reason of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.9 <U>Fees and Expenses</U>. Whether or not the transactions contemplated
hereby are consummated pursuant hereto, (i)&nbsp;the fees and expenses associated with the Reclassification Transaction, including without limitation amending the governance documents of SIRA or SIRA GP (including without limitation, the SIRA
Limited Partnership Agreement and the SIRA GP Limited Liability Company Agreement) in connection with the Reclassification Transaction, shall be borne by SIRA, and (ii)&nbsp;the fees and expenses associated with negotiating and consummating the
transactions contemplated by this Agreement, the Other Transaction Agreements, the indicative term sheet setting forth the terms of this Agreement and the Other Transaction Agreements, structuring the transactions contemplated hereby and thereby,
and amending the governance documents of each of SRE, SIRA and SPD (including without limitation, the SIRA Limited Partnership Agreement and the SIRA GP Limited Liability Company Agreement) to reflect the governance changes in connection with
entering into the transactions contemplated by this Agreement and the Other Transaction Agreements, shall be pooled and shall be borne 50% by SSG, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-sixth</FONT> by SRE,
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-sixth</FONT> by SIRA, and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-sixth</FONT> by SPD. Each Party hereto shall pay all other fees and expenses incurred by it or on its behalf in connection with the consummation of
the transactions contemplated hereby. For the avoidance of doubt, the amount of the fees and expenses paid or payable by any party pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.9</U> shall be treated as transaction expenses and not reflected in
any calculation hereunder of budgeted or actual adjusted net income of any party. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 25 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.10 <U>Counterparts</U>. This Agreement may be executed in two or more counterparts
(delivery of which may be via email as a portable document format (.pdf)), each of which will be deemed an original, and it will not be necessary in making proof of this Agreement or the terms of this Agreement to produce or account for more than
one (1)&nbsp;of such counterparts. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.11 <U>Interpretation</U>. The article and section headings contained in this Agreement are solely
for the purpose of reference, are not part of the agreement of the parties and shall not in any way affect the meaning or interpretation of this Agreement. The words &#147;include,&#148; &#147;includes&#148; and &#147;including&#148; are deemed to
be followed by the phrase &#147;without limitation.&#148; The words, &#147;herein,&#148; &#147;hereto,&#148; &#147;hereof&#148; and words of similar import refer to this Agreement as a whole, including any annexes, schedules and exhibits hereto, and
not to any particular section, subsection, paragraph, subparagraph or clause contained in this Agreement. References in this Agreement to Sections and Section numbers are to Sections and Section numbers of this Agreement unless the context otherwise
specifies or requires. The words &#147;party&#148; or &#147;parties&#148; shall refer to parties to this Agreement. References from or through any date mean, unless otherwise specified, from and including or through and including, respectively. The
words &#147;dollar&#148; or &#147;$&#148; shall mean U.S. dollars. The word &#147;day&#148; means calendar day unless Business Day is expressly specified. Any reference to the masculine, feminine or neuter gender shall include such other genders and
any reference to the singular or plural shall include the other, in each case unless the context otherwise requires. If any action under this Agreement is required to be done or taken on a day that is not a Business Day, then such action shall be
required to be done or taken not on such day but on the first succeeding Business Day thereafter. The provisions of this Agreement shall be construed according to their fair meaning and neither for nor against any party hereto irrespective of which
party caused such provisions to be drafted. Each of the parties acknowledges that it has been represented by counsel in connection with the preparation and execution of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.12 <U>Enforcement of Agreement</U>. Each Party agrees that irreparable damage may occur in the event that the parties hereto do not perform
the provisions of this Agreement in accordance with the specific terms thereof or otherwise breach such provisions, and that money damages may not be an adequate remedy, even if available.&nbsp;The Parties hereto accordingly agree that, prior to the
valid termination of this Agreement pursuant to <U>Article VIII</U>, each Party shall be entitled to specific performance of the terms hereof, including an injunction or injunctions, to prevent breaches of this Agreement and to enforce specifically
the terms and provisions hereof, as applicable, in a court determined pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.13</U>, this being in addition to any other remedy to which they are entitled at law or in equity.&nbsp;Each Party agrees that it will
not oppose the granting of an injunction, specific performance and other equitable relief on the basis that any other party has an adequate remedy at law or that any award of specific performance is not an appropriate remedy for any reason at law or
in equity. Any Party seeking an injunction or injunctions to prevent breaches of this Agreement and to enforce specifically the terms and provisions of this Agreement shall not be required to provide any bond or other security in connection with any
such Order. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 26 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.13 <U>Forum; Service of Process</U>. Each Party hereto submits to the exclusive
jurisdiction of the Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware or, if such court does not have jurisdiction, any other state or federal court located in the State of Delaware, in any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement,
and agrees that all claims in respect of the action or proceeding may be heard and determined in any such court and agrees not to bring any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement in any other court. Each Party hereto
waives any defense of inconvenient forum to the maintenance of any action or proceeding so brought and waives any bond, surety or other security that might be required of any other party with respect thereto. Each Party hereto agrees that service of
summons and complaint or any other process that might be served in any action or proceeding may be made on such party by sending or delivering a copy of the process to the party to be served at the address of the party and in the manner provided for
the giving of notices in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.2</U>; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that nothing in this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.13</U> shall affect the right of any party to serve legal process in any other manner permitted by
Law. Each Party hereto agrees that a final, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-appealable</FONT> judgment in any action or proceeding so brought shall be conclusive and may be enforced by suit on the judgment or in any other manner provided by
Law. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.14 <U>Governing Law</U>. This Agreement shall be governed by the Laws of the State of Delaware, excluding choice of law principles
that would require the application of the Laws of a jurisdiction other than the State of Delaware. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.15 <U>WAIVER OF JURY TRIAL</U>. TO
THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, THE PARTIES HERETO HEREBY WAIVE THEIR RESPECTIVE RIGHTS TO A JURY TRIAL OF ANY CLAIM OR CAUSE OF ACTION BASED UPON OR ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY DEALINGS BETWEEN THEM RELATING TO THE SUBJECT MATTER OF
THIS TRANSACTION. THE SCOPE OF THIS WAIVER IS INTENDED TO BE <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">ALL-ENCOMPASSING</FONT> OF ANY AND ALL DISPUTES THAT MAY BE FILED IN ANY COURT AND THAT RELATE TO THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING CONTRACT
CLAIMS, TORT CLAIMS, BREACH OF DUTY CLAIMS AND ALL OTHER COMMON LAW AND STATUTORY CLAIMS. THE PARTIES HERETO ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THIS WAIVER IS A MATERIAL INDUCEMENT TO ENTER INTO A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP, THAT EACH HAS ALREADY RELIED ON THE WAIVER IN
ENTERING INTO THIS AGREEMENT AND THAT EACH WILL CONTINUE TO RELY ON THE WAIVER IN THEIR RELATED FUTURE DEALINGS. THE PARTIES HERETO FURTHER WARRANT AND REPRESENT THAT EACH HAS REVIEWED THIS WAIVER WITH ITS, HIS OR HER, AS THE CASE MAY BE, LEGAL
COUNSEL, AND THAT EACH KNOWINGLY AND VOLUNTARILY WAIVES ITS JURY TRIAL RIGHTS FOLLOWING CONSULTATION WITH LEGAL COUNSEL. THIS WAIVER IS IRREVOCABLE, MEANING THAT IT MAY NOT BE MODIFIED EITHER ORALLY OR IN WRITING, AND THE WAIVER SHALL APPLY TO ANY
SUBSEQUENT AMENDMENTS, RENEWALS, SUPPLEMENTS OR MODIFICATIONS TO THIS AGREEMENT OR TO ANY OTHER DOCUMENTS OR AGREEMENTS RELATING TO THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY. IN THE EVENT OF LITIGATION, THIS AGREEMENT MAY BE FILED AS A WRITTEN CONSENT TO
A TRIAL BY THE COURT. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 27 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.16 <U>Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Appointment</U>. Each of the Sellers agrees that it is desirable to designate James O&#146;Leary as the initial Asset Class&nbsp;Head.
The Asset Class&nbsp;Head is hereby named as the representative of the Sellers and as their <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">attorney-in-fact,</FONT></FONT> with full power of substitution to act on behalf of the
Sellers to the extent and in the manner set forth in this Agreement and any other documents in connection with the Transactions. All decisions, actions, consents and instructions by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head with respect to this Agreement and any
other documents in connection with the Transactions shall be binding upon all of the Sellers, and no such Seller shall have the right to object to, dissent from, protest or otherwise contest the same. STEP and SSG shall be entitled to rely on any
decision, action, consent or instruction of the Asset Class&nbsp;Head as being the decision, action, consent or instruction of the Sellers, and STEP and SSG are hereby relieved from any liability to any Person for acts done by them in accordance
with any such decision, act, consent or instruction. By way of example and not limitation, the Asset Class&nbsp;Head shall be authorized and empowered, as agent of and on behalf of all Sellers to designate the Cash Election Percentage for the
Participating Sellers in an Exchange, give and receive notices and communications as provided herein, to agree to, negotiate, enter into settlements and compromises of, and comply with orders of courts with respect to, such claims or losses, to
waive any breach or default of STEP or SSG of any obligation to be performed by STEP or SSG under this Agreement, to receive service of process on behalf of each Seller in connection with any claims against such Seller arising under or in connection
with this Agreement, or any other agreements, instruments, certificates and documents provided for hereby or any of the transactions contemplated hereby or under any other documents in connection with the Transactions, to take all other actions that
are either (i)&nbsp;necessary or appropriate in the judgment of the Asset Class&nbsp;Head for the accomplishment of the foregoing or (ii)&nbsp;specifically mandated by the terms of this Agreement. Notices or communications to or from the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head shall constitute notice to or from the Sellers. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, STEP and SSG are entitled to rely, without inquiry, upon any document delivered by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head as being genuine and
correct and having been duly signed or sent by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Changes to the Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>.
The Person acting as Head of Infrastructure&nbsp;&amp; Real Assets of SIRA GP on the date of this Agreement shall initially be the Asset Class&nbsp;Head. In the event such Person ceases to be the Head of Infrastructure&nbsp;&amp; Real Assets of SIRA
GP, whether due to death, incapacity, resignation or otherwise, then in each case, (i)&nbsp;such Person shall automatically cease to be the Asset Class&nbsp;Head, and (ii)&nbsp;the individual elected by the Majority Holders shall become the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head for all purposes under this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Authority</U>. The grant of authority provided for in this
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.16</U> is coupled with an interest, is being granted, in part, as an inducement to STEP and SSG to enter into this Agreement and is in addition to the grant of authority provided in the Power of Attorneys, and
(i)&nbsp;shall be irrevocable and survive the dissolution, liquidation or bankruptcy of any party or the death, incompetency, liquidation or bankruptcy of any Seller, shall be binding on any successor thereto and (ii)&nbsp;shall survive the
assignment by any Seller of the whole or any portion of his, her or its interest under this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) Each Seller hereby consents to
the taking of any and all actions and the making of any decisions required or permitted to be taken or made by Asset Class&nbsp;Head pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;9.16</U>. Each Seller agrees that the Asset Class&nbsp;Head shall
have no obligation or liability to any Person for any action taken or omitted by her in good faith, and each Seller shall indemnify and hold harmless the Asset Class&nbsp;Head from, and shall pay to the Asset Class&nbsp;Head the amount of, or
reimburse the Asset Class&nbsp;Head for, any loss that the Asset Class&nbsp;Head may suffer, sustain or become subject to </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 28 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
as a result of any such action or omission by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head under this Agreement. The Asset Class&nbsp;Head may seek the advice of legal counsel in the event of any dispute or
question as to the construction of any of the provisions of this Agreement or her duties hereunder, and, without limiting the foregoing, shall incur no liability in his capacity as the Asset Class&nbsp;Head to the Sellers and shall be fully
protected with respect to any action taken, omitted or suffered by it in good faith in accordance with the advice of such counsel. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e)
Any expenses or liabilities incurred by the Asset Class&nbsp;Head in connection with the performance of its duties under this Agreement or any other documents in connection with the Transactions shall not be the personal obligation of the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head but shall be payable by the Sellers. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE X </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>DEFINITIONS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Statement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(c)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration Party</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(h)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjusted Holdback</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(f)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjustment Statement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Affiliate</U>&#148; means, with reference to a specified Person, any other Person that, directly or indirectly, through one or more
intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with, the specified Person. For purposes of this definition, the term &#147;control&#148; (including with correlative meanings, the terms &#147;controlling&#148;,
&#147;controlled by&#148;, and &#147;under common control with&#148;), with respect to any Person, means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of such Person, either
through the ownership of a majority of such Person&#146;s voting stock, by contract or otherwise. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148; has the
meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Aggregate Equity Limit</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.8(a)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Annual Exchange Schedule</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.1(a)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Antitrust Laws</U>&#148; means any antitrust, competition or trade regulation Laws
that are designed or intended to prohibit, restrict or regulate actions having the purpose or effect of monopolization or restraint of trade or lessening competition through merger or acquisition, including without limitation the HSR Act, the
Sherman Antitrust Act of 1890, the Clayton Act of 1914, the Federal Trade Commission Act of 1914, Council Regulation (EC) No 139/2004 of 20&nbsp;January 2004 on the control of concentrations between undertakings in the European Union. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Applicable Outside Date</U>&#148; means has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;8.1(b)</U>. </P>

in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;7.5</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>blocked person</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in

banks in New York, New York are authorized or obligated by applicable Law or executive order to close. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Cash Consideration
Amount</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Cash Election Notice</U>&#148; has the

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Code</U>&#148; means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Company Recommendation</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;7.2(b)</U>. </P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Effective Time</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.2(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Equity Percentage</U>&#148; means, with respect to certain Exchanged Units, a percentage representing (a)&nbsp;such Exchanged Units
<I>divided</I> by (b)&nbsp;the total number of issued and outstanding Equity Securities of SIRA. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Equity Securities</U>&#148;
means, with respect to any Person, any and all partnership interests, capital stock, options or other equity securities in such Person, and all securities exchangeable for or convertible or exercisable into, any of the foregoing. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Exchange</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Exchange Agreement</U>&#148; means an exchange agreement in substantially in the form attached hereto as <U>Exhibit B</U>. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 30 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Exchange Act</U>&#148; means the U.S. Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.

September&nbsp;20, 2021, by and among STEP and the other Persons party thereto. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Final Acceleration Exchange Value</U>&#148; has

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Governmental Approval</U>&#148; means any consent, approval or authorization of, or registration, declaration or filing with, any
Governmental Authority. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Governmental Authority</U>&#148; means any government, court, regulatory or administrative agency,
arbitral body or self-regulated entity, tribunal, commission or authority or other legislative, executive or judicial governmental entity, whether federal, national, provincial, state, local, foreign or multinational. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>GP Board</U>&#148; means the Board of Directors of SIRA GP. </P>

thereunder. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>HSR Approval</U>&#148; means the expiration or termination of any applicable waiting periods under the HSR Act or

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Tax</U>&#148; or &#147;<U>Taxes</U>&#148; means (a)&nbsp;any federal, state, local
or foreign income, gross receipts, franchise, estimated, alternative minimum, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">add-on</FONT> minimum, sales, use, transfer, real property gains, registration, value added, excise, natural resources, severance, stamp,
occupation, premium, windfall profit, environmental, customs, duties, real property, special assessment, personal property, capital stock, social security, unemployment, disability, payroll, license, employee or other withholding, or other tax, of
any kind whatsoever, including any interest, penalties or additions to tax or additional amounts in respect of the foregoing; (b)&nbsp;any liability for payment of amounts described in clause (a)&nbsp;whether as a result of transferee liability, of
being a member of an affiliated, consolidated, combined or unitary group for any period or otherwise through operation of law; and (c)&nbsp;any liability for the payment of amounts described in clauses (a)&nbsp;or (b) as a result of any tax sharing,
tax receivable, tax indemnity or tax allocation agreement or any other express or implied agreement to indemnify any other Person (other than any commercial agreement entered into in the ordinary course of business and the primary focus of which is
not Tax). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Tax Receivable Agreement</U>&#148; means that certain Tax Receivable Agreement (Exchanges), dated as of
September&nbsp;18, 2020, by and among STEP, SSG, and each of the other persons and entities parties thereto. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Termination
Acceleration Exchange</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Annex C</U> this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Trading Day</U>&#148; means a day on
which (i)&nbsp;trading in the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or other security for which a closing sale price must be determined) generally occurs on Nasdaq or, if the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is not then listed on
Nasdaq, on the principal other U.S. national or regional securities exchange on which the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is then listed or, if the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is not then listed on
a U.S. national or regional securities exchange, on the principal other market on which the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is then traded and (ii)&nbsp;a last reported sale price for the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or
closing sale price for such other security) is available on such securities exchange or market; <U>provided</U>, <U>that</U>, if the STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or such other security) is not so listed or traded, &#147;Trading Day&#148; means a
Business Day. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Transaction</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Transfer</U>&#148;, including correlative terms, means, with respect to any Seller, any sale, conveyance, exchange, assignment,
pledge, encumbrance, gift, bequest, hypothecation or other transfer or disposition by any other means, of any or all of such Seller&#146;s shares of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (or other economic interest in STEP), whether for value or no value
and whether directly or indirectly, voluntary or involuntary (including, without limitation, by operation of law), or an agreement to do any of the foregoing. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>UNSC</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;3.6(c)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Upward Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Upward Acceleration Exchange Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6(c)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>willful and material breach</U>&#148; means has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;8.2(a)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">* * * * * </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>[</B><B><I>Signature Pages Follow</I></B><B>] </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 35 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

first above written. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <DIV ALIGN="right">

<TR>

</TABLE></DIV> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">[<I>Signature Page to Transaction Agreement</I>] </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>ANNEX A </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>Calculation of Exchange Value </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>General Definitions </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjusted Net Income</U>&#148; means adjusted net income, as such term is defined in STEP&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
measures as filed with the SEC from time to time or, if no such definition exists in STEP public filings, then such metric as defined in good faith by the STEP Board. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Adjusted Shares Outstanding</U>&#148; means a number of adjusted shares, calculated as of the Reference Date and not as a weighted-average over time,
using the methodology used to calculate Adjusted Weighted-Average Shares in STEP&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures as filed with the SEC from time to time or, if no such calculation of Adjusted Weighted-Average Shares
exists in STEP public filings, then such metric as defined in good faith by the STEP Board. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Applicable SIRA Multiple</U>&#148; means, with
respect to an Exchange, a number calculated as of the Reference Date for such Exchange and equal to the STEP Multiple <I>multiplied by</I> (a) 65%, if the STEP Multiple equals 40, (b) 89%, if the STEP Multiple equals 16, and (c)&nbsp;a percentage
ratably based on (a)&nbsp;and (b), if the STEP Multiple is greater than 16 and less than 40. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Baseline Exchange Value</U>&#148; means an amount
equal to (a)&nbsp;the Exchange Value, multiplied by (b)&nbsp;the Participation Percentage. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Calculated SIRA Value</U>&#148; means (a)&nbsp;with
respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange, (i)&nbsp;the SIRA Budget ANI as of the Reference Date for such Exchange, <I>multiplied by</I> (ii)&nbsp;the Applicable SIRA Multiple for such Exchange, and (b)&nbsp;with respect to an
Acceleration Exchange, (i)&nbsp;the Acceleration SIRA Budget ANI as of the Reference Date for the Acceleration Exchange, <I>multiplied by</I> (ii)&nbsp;the Applicable SIRA Multiple for such Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Exchange Value</U>&#148; for an Exchange means an amount equal to (a)&nbsp;the Calculated SIRA Value, <I>multiplied by</I> (b)&nbsp;the aggregate
Equity Percentage represented by all Exchanged Units in such Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Forward ANI Multiple</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange, the
ratio of (a)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP, <I>multiplied by</I> (b)&nbsp;the total number of Adjusted Shares Outstanding on the Reference Date of such Exchange (for the avoidance of doubt, excluding any
Consideration Units to be issued as of such date), <I>divided by</I> (c)&nbsp;(i) with respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange, the STEP Budget ANI, or (ii)&nbsp;with respect to an Acceleration Exchange, the Acceleration STEP
Budget ANI. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>SIRA Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange, the budgeted Adjusted Net Income
of SIRA, as prepared in good faith utilizing a consistent methodology as STEP and approved by the Board of Directors of SIRA, for the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period beginning on the Reference Date. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange that is not an Acceleration Exchange,
the budgeted Adjusted Net Income of STEP, as approved by the STEP Board for the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period beginning on the Reference Date (for the avoidance of doubt, for purposes of calculating the Exchange Value of
any Exchange, the STEP Budget ANI as applied shall be calculated assuming the Exchanged Units for such Exchange have not yet been acquired by STEP and, accordingly, shall not reflect any pro forma adjustment for the acquisition of such Exchanged
Units). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>STEP Multiple</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Exchange, a number calculated as of the Reference Date for such Exchange and equal to
the Forward ANI Multiple; provided, that such multiple shall not be greater than 40. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>Acceleration Exchange Definitions </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration SIRA</U><U> Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Acceleration Exchange, the budgeted Adjusted Net Income of SIRA, as prepared
in good faith utilizing a consistent methodology as STEP and approved by the GP Board, for the Initial Projection Year; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that in calculating such amount, the Performance Fee Related Earnings of SIRA for the Initial
Projection Year shall be the Average Performance Fee Related Earnings of SIRA. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Acceleration STEP Budget ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an
Acceleration Exchange, the budgeted Adjusted Net Income of STEP, as approved by the STEP Board, for the Initial Projection Year (for the avoidance of doubt, for purposes of calculating the Exchange Value of any Acceleration Exchange, the STEP Budget
ANI as applied shall be calculated assuming the Exchanged Units for such Acceleration Exchange have not yet been acquired by STEP and, accordingly, shall not reflect any pro forma adjustment for the acquisition of such Exchanged Units);
<U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that in calculating such amount, the Performance Fee Related Earnings of STEP for the Initial Projection Year shall be the Average Performance Fee Related Earnings of STEP. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Actual Acceleration SIRA ANI</U>&#148; means, with respect to an Acceleration Exchange, the actual Adjusted Net Income of SIRA used to prepare the
STEP Audited Financials for the Initial Projection Year; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that in calculating such amount, the Performance Fee Related Earnings of SIRA for the Initial Projection Year shall be replaced with the Average Performance
Fee Related Earnings of SIRA. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Average Performance Fee Related Earnings</U>&#148; means the average of the Performance Fee Related Earnings for
(i)&nbsp;the Initial Projection Year, (ii)&nbsp;the Second Projection Year and (iii)&nbsp;the Final Projection Year. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Final Projection
Year</U>&#148; means the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period starting immediately after the end of the Second Projection Year. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Initial Projection Year</U>&#148; means, for an Acceleration Exchange, the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period beginning on the
Reference Date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Performance Fee Related Earnings</U>&#148; means the performance related revenue (including performance related fee revenue,
incentive fee revenue and carried interest) less performance fee related compensation expense. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Second Projection Year</U>&#148; means the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">12-month</FONT> period
starting immediately after the end of the Initial Projection Year. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE B </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>Annual Exchange Schedule<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP> </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>

<TD WIDTH="20%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="79%"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reference Date</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Portion of Equity Securities of SIRA to be
Acquired</B></P></TD></TR>


<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2024</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">20% of the difference between SSG&#146;s ownership amount upon execution of this Agreement and 75%</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2025</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">20% of the difference between SSG&#146;s ownership amount upon execution of this Agreement and 75%</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2026</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">20% of the difference between SSG&#146;s ownership amount upon execution of this Agreement and 75%</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2027</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">20% of the difference between SSG&#146;s ownership amount upon execution of this Agreement and 75%</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2028</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">20% of the difference between SSG&#146;s ownership amount upon execution of this Agreement and 75%</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2029</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">5.0%</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2030</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">5.0%</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2031</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">5.0%</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff" STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2032</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">5.0%</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">April&nbsp;1, 2033</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center">5.0%</TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Notwithstanding the other terms of this Agreement, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the Closing of the fifth annual
Exchange, the CEO (or equivalent) of SIRA may make a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> election, by delivering a notice to STEP and SSG, to reduce the annual Exchange percentage for all future Exchanges from 5.0% per year to 2.5% per
year. </P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">Schedule to be updated by SSG and the Asset Class Head by mutual agreement once post-unitization is available
to provide an exact number of SIRA units.<U> </U> </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>

<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>TRANSACTION AGREEMENT </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>by and among </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>STEPSTONE

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right">23</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9.5</P></TD>

&#150; Calculation of Exchange Value </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annex B</U> &#150; Required Regulatory Approvals </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Annex C</U> &#150; Termination Acceleration Exchange </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">-ii- </P>

</DIV></Center>

<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedules: </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule A</U> &#150; Annual Exchange Schedule </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Schedule
B</U> &#150; SPD Swap Schedule </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibits</U>: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibit A</U> &#150; Form of Registration Rights Agreement </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exhibit B</U> &#150; SCP Capitalization Table </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">-iii- </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>TRANSACTION AGREEMENT </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">This TRANSACTION AGREEMENT (this &#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;), dated as of February&nbsp;7, 2024, is by and among StepStone Group Inc., a
Delaware corporation (&#147;<U>STEP</U>&#148;), StepStone Group LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#147;<U>SSG</U>&#148;), Stepstone Europe Limited, a private limited liability company incorporated in England (&#147;<U>SSE</U>&#148; and together
with STEP and SSG, &#147;<U>StepStone</U>&#148;), Marcel Schindler, solely in his capacity as the representative of the Seller under this Agreement, Swiss Capital Alternative Investments AG, a private company limited by shares incorporated in the
canton of Zurich (&#147;<U>SPD</U>&#148;), SC Partner LP, a Cayman Islands exempted limited partnership, acting by its general partner SC General Partner Limited (the &#147;<U>Seller</U>&#148; and together with STEP, SSG, SSE, the Asset
Class&nbsp;Head, each a &#147;<U>Party</U>&#148; and collectively, the &#147;<U>Parties</U>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>RECITALS </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>to support the ongoing operational integration of business practices and to enhance client and staff experiences at
StepStone and SPD, the Parties desire to enter into this Transaction Agreement to facilitate the medium to long-term economic integration of the Parties; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>in furtherance of the purposes in the foregoing recital, the Parties intend for the Seller to exchange, in a series of
transactions, the Seller&#146;s equity interests in SPD for equity interests in STEP (or cash in lieu of a portion thereof) (collectively, the &#147;<U>Transactions</U>&#148;, and each such exchange, an &#147;<U>Exchange</U>&#148;); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, substantially concurrently with the execution and delivery of this Agreement, StepStone has separately entered into (i)&nbsp;a
transaction agreement (the &#147;<U>SIRA Transaction Agreement</U>&#148;) with StepStone Group Real Assets LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#147;<U>SIRA</U>&#148;), certain equityholders of SIRA parties thereto and the seller representative of
SIRA (the &#147;<U>SIRA Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;a transaction agreement (the &#147;<U>SRE Transaction Agreement</U>&#148;) with StepStone Group Real Estate LP, a Delaware limited partnership
(&#147;<U>SRE</U>&#148;), certain equityholders of SRE parties thereto and the seller representative of SRE (the &#147;<U>SRE Asset Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;Head</U>&#148;); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, subject to the terms and conditions in this Agreement, including with respect to any Acceleration Exchange, Termination
Acceleration Exchange and Change of Control Exchange (each as defined below), the Parties intend to consummate ten (10)&nbsp;annual Exchanges, with the first Exchange to be conducted with a reference date of April&nbsp;1, 2024 (the &#147;<U>Initial
Reference Date</U>&#148;) and to be consummated promptly following the Initial Reference Date upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in this Agreement applicable to such Exchange, and the nine (9)&nbsp;subsequent Exchanges to be
conducted with a reference date of each of the nine (9)&nbsp;following anniversaries of the Initial Reference Date (such dates, together with the Initial Reference Date, each, a &#147;<U>Reference Date</U>&#148;) and to be consummated promptly
following each applicable Reference Date upon the satisfaction or waiver of the conditions set forth in this Agreement applicable to such Exchanges; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B> </B>the Parties intend that, at the consummation of the tenth (10<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">th</SUP>)
Exchange or the Acceleration Exchange (as defined below), SSG (or its nominee) will own all of the outstanding equity interests of SPD; and </P> <P STYLE="font-size:18pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B>, in consideration of the foregoing and the mutual representations,
warranties, covenants and agreements set forth herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, and intending to be legally bound hereby, the Parties hereby agree as follows: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE I </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>THE EXCHANGE
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.1 <U>The Exchange</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Upon the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement, at each Closing (as defined below), the Seller shall sell, convey, assign,
transfer and deliver to SSG (or to its nominee), and SSG (or its nominee) shall purchase, acquire and accept from the Seller, all of the Seller&#146;s right, title and interest in and to such amount of Equity Securities of SPD set forth in
<U>Schedule A</U> attached hereto (the &#147;<U>Annual Exchange Schedule</U>&#148;) for the Reference Date of the relevant Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, any Equity Securities of SPD exchanged pursuant to this Agreement may be referred to
as the &#147;<U>Exchanged Securities</U>&#148;. The Exchanged Securities that are the subject of any Exchange shall correspond to the SCP Participations allocated among the SCP Partners in accordance with <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.9</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) In exchange therefor, at each Closing (except with respect to an Acceleration Exchange, which shall be governed by
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.6</U>), SSG shall convey to the Seller the Adjusted Exchange Value by (i)&nbsp;pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.3</U>, delivering to the Seller an amount in cash equal to (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Exchange Value
<I>multiplied</I> by the Cash Percentage for such Exchange, <I>plus</I> (y)&nbsp;the Fractional Equity Payment, and (ii)&nbsp;causing STEP to issue to the Seller the number of whole shares of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock (rounded down to the
nearest whole share of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock) (the &#147;<U>Consideration Securitie</U>s&#148;) equal to (x)&nbsp;(A) the Adjusted Exchange Value <I>less</I> (B)&nbsp;the cash amount delivered pursuant to the foregoing clause (i)(x),
<I>divided</I> by (y)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP. Additionally, at the Closing of the Fifth Exchange (or, if applicable, an Acceleration Exchange), SSG shall make payment in cash to the Seller of the
liquidation preference compensation amount in respect of the Exchanged Securities in such Exchange which are Preferred Shares CHF 100 (as set forth in <U>Schedule A</U> attached hereto), which shall be in an aggregate amount equal to CHF
4,860,863.50. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) In lieu of the issuance of any fractional share of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, if the Seller would otherwise have
been entitled to a fractional share of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, then the Seller shall be paid cash, without interest (the &#147;<U>Fractional Equity Payment</U>&#148;), in an amount equal to
(i)&nbsp;the fractional share of STEP Class&nbsp;A Common Stock to which the Seller would otherwise be entitled under <U>Article I</U> of this Agreement <I>multiplied</I> by (ii)&nbsp;the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP, and
rounded to the nearest cent. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) Upon the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement, immediately prior to the Closing of the
First Exchange, the Seller shall sell, convey, assign, transfer and deliver to SSG (or its nominee), and SSG (or its nominee) shall purchase, acquire and accept from the Seller, all of the Seller&#146;s right, title and interest in and to such
amount of Equity Securities of SPD as is set forth in the first column of <U>Schedule B</U> attached hereto (the </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 2 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
&#147;<U>SPD Swap Schedule</U>&#148;) in consideration for (i)&nbsp;the sale, conveyance, assignment, transfer and delivery by SSG (or an Affiliate of SSG) to the Seller of all of SSG&#146;s (or
SSG&#146;s Affiliate, as applicable) right, title and interest in and to such amount of Equity Securities of SPD set forth in the second column of the SPD Swap Schedule and (ii)&nbsp;the payment in cash by SSG to the Seller of the liquidation
preference compensation amount set out in the third column of the SPD Swap Schedule. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.2 <U>Closing</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) The closing of any Exchange (each a &#147;<U>Closing</U>&#148;) shall take place remotely via electronic exchange of documents and
signatures, as promptly as practicable following, but in no event later than, the third (3<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">rd</SUP>) Business Day after the satisfaction or waiver of each of the conditions set forth in <U>Article II</U>
of this Agreement applicable to such Closing (other than, but subject to satisfaction of, the conditions to be satisfied on the applicable Closing Date); <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, in no event shall a Closing take place prior to the first (1<SUP
STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">st</SUP>) Business Day after the latest of (i)&nbsp;the last day of the determination period for the STEP <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP for such Exchange, (ii)&nbsp;the date on which
STEP issues its audited financial statements for its latest fiscal year ending prior to the Closing (the &#147;<U>STEP Audited Financials</U>&#148;), and (iii)&nbsp;the date on which the Adjustment Statement is delivered in respect of the preceding
Exchange. For purposes of this Agreement, the date of the Closing with respect to an Exchange may be referred to as the &#147;<U>Closing Date</U>&#148; of such Exchange, and the effective time of the Closing with respect to an Exchange may be
referred as the &#147;<U>Effective Time</U>&#148; of such Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) The failure to consummate an Exchange on the date and time
determined pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.2(a)</U> shall not result in the termination of this Agreement or relieve any Party of any of its obligations under this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.3 <U>Cash </U><U>Percentage</U>. The Cash Percentage for each Exchange shall be twenty percent (20%). Subject to restrictions under
applicable Law, any governance documents of STEP and SSG, and any credit agreement, loan agreement, note, indenture or other financing agreements under which STEP or SSG is bound, and subject to the receipt of any applicable stockholder or
regulatory approval, SSG, at its sole discretion, shall use commercially reasonable efforts to deliver, or cause to be delivered, at Closing the cash portion of the Exchange Value (or, for each Exchange other than the first Exchange, the Reduced
Exchange Value) that corresponds to the Cash Percentage; <U>provided, that</U>, to the extent SSG does not deliver, or cause to be delivered, all or a portion of such cash consideration, the cash portion of the Exchange Value for the relevant
Exchange to be delivered pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.1(b)(i)(x)</U> shall be ratably reduced and, consequently, the number of Consideration Securities to be delivered pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.1(b)(ii)</U> shall be
ratably increased. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.4 <U>Distribution Adjustments</U>. It is intended that (a)&nbsp;any distributions made by SPD in respect of the
Exchanged Securities with respect to any period (i)&nbsp;ending prior to the Reference Date for an Exchange will inure to the benefit of the Seller and (ii)&nbsp;commencing on or after the applicable Reference Date for an Exchange will inure to the
benefit of SSG (or its nominee); and that (b)&nbsp;the Consideration Securities issued in such Exchange shall entitle the Seller to receive a cash payment in an amount equal in value to any distributions made by STEP in respect of such Consideration
Securities with respect to any period commencing on or after the applicable Reference Date. Consistent with the foregoing, it is intended that any </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 3 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
distributions made in respect of the other Equity Securities that are transferred by (A)&nbsp;the Seller to SSG (or its nominee) pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.1(d)</U> with respect
to any period (i)&nbsp;ending prior to the Reference Date for the First Exchange will inure to the benefit of the Seller and (ii)&nbsp;commencing on or after the applicable Reference Date for the First Exchange will inure to the benefit of SSG (or
its nominee, as applicable) and (B)&nbsp;SSG (or its nominee) to the Seller pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.1(d)</U> with respect to any period (i)&nbsp;ending prior to the Reference Date for the First Exchange will inure to the benefit
of SSG (or its nominee, as applicable) and (ii)&nbsp;commencing on or after the applicable Reference Date for the First Exchange will inure to the benefit of the Seller. In the event any such distributions are paid or made to a Person in a manner
inconsistent with such intent, then the Parties shall make appropriate adjustments to the consideration delivered in such Exchange or in the subsequent Exchanges. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.5 <U><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">True-Up</FONT></U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Adjustment Statement</U>. As soon as practicable, but in no event later than ten (10)&nbsp;days after each issuance of the STEP Audited
Financials, SSG shall deliver to the Asset Class&nbsp;Head a statement (an &#147;<U>Adjustment Statement</U>&#148;) setting forth SSG&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-calculation</FONT> of the Exchange Value of the last Exchange by
applying the Applicable SPD Multiple as of the preceding Reference Date to the actual Adjusted Net Income of SPD (rather than the SPD Budget ANI) used to prepare the STEP Audited Financials (such recalculated amount, the &#147;<U>Final Exchange
Value</U>&#148;). An &#147;<U>Upward Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between (w)&nbsp;the Final Exchange Value and (x)&nbsp;the Exchange Value originally calculated and used for such Exchange
(the &#147;<U>Original Exchange Value</U>&#148;); and a &#147;<U>Downward Adjustment Amount</U>&#148; shall exist to the extent (if any) of the positive difference between (y)&nbsp;the Original Exchange Value and (z)&nbsp;the Final Exchange Value.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Upward Adjustment</U>. If an Upward Adjustment Amount exists, then STEP shall, at the Closing of the current year&#146;s Exchange,
(x)&nbsp;issue an additional amount of Consideration Securities (rounded down to the nearest whole Consideration Security) to the Seller equal to (A)&nbsp;the Upward Adjustment Amount divided by (B)&nbsp;the STEP
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">30-Day</FONT> VWAP and (y)&nbsp;pay or cause to be paid to the Seller an amount of cash equal to the applicable Fractional Equity Payment. For the avoidance of doubt, any reference to Upward Adjustment Amount in this
paragraph shall be a reference to the Upward Adjustment Amount with respect to the preceding Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Downward Adjustment</U>. If
a Downward Adjustment Amount exists, then in the current year Exchange (x)&nbsp;the Reduced Exchange Value shall be decreased by the Downward Adjustment Amount and (y)&nbsp;the Adjusted Exchange Value shall equal the Reduced Exchange Value as
adjusted pursuant to clause (x). To the extent the Reduced Exchange Value would fall below zero as a result of an adjustment pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>, then, at SSG&#146;s option, (i)&nbsp;the Seller shall promptly
(and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG an amount in cash equal to the remaining Downward Adjustment Amount or (ii)&nbsp;the remaining Downward Adjustment Amount shall be carried forward to the next succeeding future Exchange(s). To
the extent any remaining balance of the applicable portion of any Downward Adjustment Amount exists immediately after the Closing of the final Exchange, the Seller shall promptly (and in any event within thirty (30)&nbsp;days) pay SSG or its
designee an amount in cash equal to such remaining </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">- 4 - </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
balance. The Seller acknowledges and agrees that, in the event that the Seller does not timely pay SSG any cash amount payable by the Seller to SSG pursuant to this
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.5(c)</U>, SSG shall have the right to set off such cash amount against any dividends, distributions or other income allocations from SSG or its Affiliates to the Seller or its Affiliates and against any other amounts
(including, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, employment compensation and expense reimbursements) otherwise payable by SSG or its Affiliates to the Seller or its Affiliates. For the avoidance of doubt, any reference to Downward Adjustment
Amount in this paragraph shall be a reference to the Downward Adjustment Amount with respect to the preceding Exchange. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1.6
